title: Kiddie Academy of Hillsborough - Assistant Toddler Teacher
description:
**Job Description**

The Kiddie Academy of Hillsborough, is a very well reputed child care / preschool that opened in May, 2018 in Hillsborough, NJ. Our passion and desire is to deliver the highest quality childcare possible. This passion, and the brands **35 years in business** , has earned a leadership position in education-based childcare. It’s what drives us as the location owners to positively shape the lives of children, families and communities everywhere. Kiddie Academy is based on the foundation of Life Essentials - Every experience is an opportunity to learn! *Life Essentials* ® is an overarching philosophy that includes our programs and techniques. From family style dining to character education, our developmentally appropriate curriculum gives the child a full day of learning no matter what he or she is doing. Some of the best learning happens without the child knowing it.

We are currently looking for a Lead Toddler Teacher with flexible hours for our Toddler classrooms (13-36 months of age)

**Daily Responsibilities:** Our Lead and Assistant Teachers work together:

* Understanding the Life Essentials curriculum thoroughly and developing and implementing supplemental lesson plans (as required) based on the monthly and seasonal themes and the interests of the children in the classroom
* Meeting the individual needs of the children including feeding and diapering
* Participating in staff and training meetings
* Designing an appropriate room arrangement to support the goals and developmental level of the children in the classroom
* Interacting with the children to support play, exploration, and learning and working through exciting projects
* Presenting expectations that are appropriate to the child’s age and developmental level
* Planning and implementing activities that develop self-esteem, confidence and social skills
* Communicating appropriately and professionally with children, parents and fellow staff using Academy tools and resources
* Meeting Kiddie Academy's Quality Assurance and NJ state licensing requirements

Lead Teachers are responsible for ensuring compliance with Kiddie Academy's industry-leading Quality Assurance standards. Most importantly, they create a positive learning environment in their classroom where children develop a lifelong love of learning!

**Lead Teacher Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s in Education, Psychology, Health Care, Nursing, or any other field related to Growth and Development or Teaching certification from DOE in Elementary Ed and six credits and 2 years of experience - preferred
* Strong written and communication skills, ability to communicate with parents and building life-long relationships
* Experience working in a educational day care facility - at least 2 years preferred
* A Bachelor’s degree or higher in Early Childhood Education and Development.
* A Bachelor’s degree or higher in a related field, including 18 semester hours of completed coursework related to young children birth to age 8.
* An Associate’s degree or higher in Early Childhood Education, Elementary Education, Child Development or a related field.
* An Associate’s degree or higher in a related field, including 18 semester hours of completed coursework related to young children birth to age 8.
* A current CDA or Early Childhood Teaching Credential.

**Job Type: Full-time**

title: QA Automation Intern
description:
Organizational Profile:

The Mayor's Office of Contract Services (MOCS) is a New York City oversight and service agency that manages

procurement citywide, from planning and release of agency solicitations to payment of vendors. Annually, agencies

procure billions in products and services from a diverse pool of vendors that represent various industries. MOCS

therefore aims to ensure that the procurement process remains fair, transparent, efficient, and cost-effective.

MOCS makes it easier to do business through use of end-to-end technology tools, increases transparency by

publication of enriched data and hosting public hearings, and strengthens procurement operations by providing direct

assistance and resources to all stakeholders. MOCS also partners with agencies and vendors to identify areas for

policy reform, resulting in ongoing process improvement to reduce administrative burdens and increase the positive

impact of services on communities. The MOCS Director serves as the City Chief Procurement Officer.

About Division/Unit:

The Tech Innovation & Solution Division leverages technology to enable MOCS staff to streamline New York City's

contracting process and is responsible for all aspects of technology operations. The BQ/QA unit expose to all phases

of software development life cycle (SDLC), experiencing more than iteration of a digital product comes to life, support

on production issues as well as maintenance releases. Also participate in project sessions along with multiple internal

and external teams, such as: Business Analysts, Data Analytics, Platform Development, Procurement Operations,

General Counsel, and Service Desk…etc.

Responsibilities:

· Learn and understand the digital product PASSPort (Procurement and Sourcing Solutions Portal).

· Create user stories and conceptualize future states for user experience, new or enhanced data products.

· Participate in discovery sessions to observe, document, and validate business processes and capture key

insights using a variety of research methods.

· Use insights from data analytics to support business initiatives and business process improvements.

· Work on automation scripts to test some functions of PASSPort.

· Write Basic SQL, including SELECT, DELETE, UPDATE statements with WHERE clause.

· Update the stakeholders daily/weekly as per request.

Qualification /Preferred Skills:

· Excellent writing, technical and interpersonal skills.

· Meet deadlines and work independently while paying close attention to details.

· Ability to learn and understand complex concepts quickly.

· Understanding of Software Development, Software Testing, and Object-Oriented Programming.

· Some understanding of HTML, CSS. · Basic SQL skills (select, joins, subqueries), preferred but not required. · Establish relationships quickly and maximize positive team dynamics.

Learning Outcomes:

· Gain knowledge on PASSPort (Procurement and Sourcing Solutions Portal).

· Professional skills related to Business Analysis, Software Quality Assurance.

· Implement OOPs concepts in Automation Testing.

· Write structured and clean code in JAVA or Python.

· Create test cases using Behavioral Driven Development (BDD) approach.

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $17.00 - $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 17 – 35 per week

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10007 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10007: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Assistant General Manager
description:
We appreciate your interest in employment with Barry's! Barry's is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity, and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law. Applicants with disabilities who need assistance with the application process may be entitled to a reasonable accommodation in accordance with applicable law. If you need assistance in completing this application or with the application process because of a disability, please contact the People and Culture Department (people@barrys.com or 323-673-0222).



The Assistant General Manager (AGM) is the studio leader accountable for the crucial intersection of client experience, and community building. In supporting the General Manager (GM) the AGM is second in command. They have a tremendous impact on: driving client acquisition, conversion, retention and achieving the KPI's, providing the best in class customer service experience for our clients, supporting talent acquisition & development activities, and operations, while demonstrating Barry's core values. The AGM is responsible for ensuring alignment with and consistent execution of Barry's hospitality standards. It is an expectation of the AGM to effectively and strategically execute national campaigns and initiatives while driving community engagement and budget, and facilitate in-studio campaigns and events. This role requires the ability to lead alongside a team. Manage teams while maintaining and thriving in a fast-paced, people-filled setting.



### **Key Responsibilities**



The ability to consistently and reliably perform the following duties is essential and necessary to accomplish the central purposes and requirements of this position:


**Studio Operations**


* Works collaboratively with Barry's Operations leadership team to foster and preserve the corporate mission, vision, and values
* Maintain a 40 hour per week working presence in studio, showcasing best of brand skills while there
* Lead the studio team in knowledge and motivation to drive class, fuel bar and retail sales that exceed all studio goals and targets
* Serve as the leader on duty, overseeing seamless class check-ins, opening and closing the studio in accordance with all policies and procedures, and overseeing studio staff on duty
* Partner with the GM to analyze key business performance indicators (paid attendance, first timers, utilization, conversion, and labor) and bring any insights or suggestions to regional leadership on a weekly and monthly basis
* Participate in monthly studio business unit meetings, reviewing P&L and opportunities to drive incremental business performance
* Support the GM to conduct regular brand audits of all studio spaces and manage projects to ensure facilities are clean and updated, working with local and corporate leadership on quick execution of facilities initiatives and repairs
* Provide operational support to the GM as required by business need, assisting with studio accounting, timecards, inventory, ordering, and scheduling needs


**Team Management**


* Foster the creation of a supportive and inclusive environment to ensure a positive, and engaging experience for all team members and clients
* Assist the GM in hiring, coaching, onboarding and developing a service-minded and high performing team; while creating a talent bench
* Supervise studio team members on shift, aiding with, as well as coaching and mentoring to deliver on the client experience
* Drive teamwork, collaboration, and cohesion among all studio staff to consistently, efficiently, and effectively meet day-today operational needs
+ Support a performance culture of ownership, continuous improvement and goal achievement
+ Work alongside team members in all departments to provide hands-on coaching, training, and development

* Operate autonomously in the spirit of the Barry's code of conduct in the absence of the GM adhering to all P&C policies, procedures and guidelines
**Hospitality Management**


* Partner with GM to oversee the implementation and execution of all hospitality processes, ensuring all team members have been consistently trained and their skills are continuously developed
* Train and provide ongoing development to team members in service of ensuring a consistent client experience and upholding our mission, vision, values, and hospitality standards
* Oversee milestone, loyalty, and surprise and delight program implementation and execution in studio, celebrating special events with regularity, in accordance with guidelines to drive community and retention
* Manage studio systems:
	+ Zendesk
	+ Brandbot
* Ensure all client matters are properly and swiftly resolved or escalated, and ensure consistent and adequate follow through to all client inquiries


**Community Marketing and Business Development**


* Drive business through clienteling, sourcing new customers, and fostering ongoing productive relationships with customers
* Build and foster strong, meaningful relationships with the studio team and client community, proactively identifying opportunities to show recognition or gratitude, enhance engagement, and/or address conflicts
* Partner with the GM and marketing leadership to localize and implement national campaigns and initiatives
* Oversee and report on the impact of the community-building budget

### **Requirements**


* 1-3 years of fitness management or relevant related experience (hospitality, retail, food/beverage, etc.).
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
* Availability for full-time work during non-traditional hours, including early mornings, late evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* Ability to train, lead, motivate, and delegate to a team of employees.
* Ability to handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment and in a time-sensitive environment.
* Ability to work cooperatively and effectively with different personality types as well as other departments, vendors, and clients.
* Exceptional written and oral communication, organization, and time management skills.
* Detail-oriented mindset, with an eye for customer satisfaction.
* Proven dependability and reliability.
* Friendly, outgoing personality and can-do, optimistic attitude.
* Professional in appearance and behavior at all times.
* Enthusiasm for the Barry's brand.
* Ability to kneel, bend, reach, climb, and stand for long durations of time.
* Ability to move and lift equipment and supplies of 30+ pounds.


Barry's is the Best Workout in the WorldTM®. Founded in West Hollywood in 1998, it's the original strength and cardio interval fitness experience that provides an immersive, high-intensity, one-hour workout that's as effective as it is fun. Our fitness classes alternate between working out with weights and running on a treadmill. Each day focuses on a different muscle group in order to achieve real results and to prevent injuries. Our program is designed to tone muscle and maximize fat loss, while spiking the metabolism for up to 48 hours following the class.



Please be aware that smoking is prohibited in all indoor areas of Barry's studios and corporate offices.



The annual salary for this position is between $65,000-$68,000, depending on experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate.



Subject to your meeting the requirements for eligibility and participation under each program, you will be eligible to participate in Barry's comprehensive benefits program which includes medical, dental, and vision insurance; short-term and long-term disability insurance, and; life and AD&D insurance



The salary and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, with or without notice, subject to applicable law.

title: Quality Inspector, Aerospace and Defense Parts
description:
**RS Precision** is an AS9100 certified and ITAR registered precision contract manufacturer providing **small, complex, precision machined parts** for Aeropace and Defense applications since 1948. We are currently looking for a full-time **Quality Inspector with prior Aerospace and Defense parts experience** to join our team at our Farmingdale, NY location. This position offers a competitive salary (based on experience) and the Benefits shown below. With training & support, you’ll be able to grow within the RS Precision family.

**BENEFITS FOR THE QUALITY INSPECTOR:**

* Health Insurance
* Paid Vacation, Holdiay and Sick days
* Profit Sharing Bonus Plan
* 401K Savings Plan

**QUALITY INSPECTOR RESPONSIBILITIES:** *(included, but not limited to)*

* Inspect complex, tight tolerance parts accurately
* Perform Receiving, In-process, and Final Inspection on customer supplied and/or purchased components/materials.
* Read and interpret applicable mechanical drawings and specifications.
* Document non-conformances and facilitate corrective actions.
* Strong problem-solving skills to identify root causes of quality issues
* Collaborate with other Quality, Manufacturing, Engineering, and Management personnel.

**REQUIREMENTS/EXPERIENCE FOR THE QUALITY INSPECTOR:**

* 5 years experience as a Quality Inspector of Aerospace and Defense parts
* Experience working in an ISO 9001 / AS9100 environment
* Proficient with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T)
* Proficient in using measuring tools such as calipers, gauges, and CMM
* Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings, 3D CAD files and customer specifications.
* Experience programming automated inspection experience, ***preferred***
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite
* Fluent in English

**ABOUT US:**

By providing a broad array of multi-process machining capabilities, RS Precision is a one-stop source for small to medium-sized, performance-critical parts, as well as EDM secondary operations. We are AS9100 and ISO-9001 certified, and ITAR registered, to ensure that our customers will receive only the highest levels of quality and consistency.

Having harnessed the specialties of EDM and Grinding, RS Precision combines these skill sets with our extensive CNC Milling capabilities to provide our customers with parts that are simply “The Best They Can Be.” Our engineering capabilities allow us to go “Beyond the Blueprint” to understand how your parts will be used so we can design manufacturing processes that will maximize both their performance and your value.

title: [Immediate 2024- 2025] Special Education Math Learning Specialist - Middle School
description:
**About KIPP NYC:**

KIPP NYC Public Schools is a non-profit network of 18 free, public charter schools in the Bronx, Brooklyn and Manhattan. We partner with families and communities to create joyful and rigorous schools in pursuit of a more just world. In 1995 we started our first middle school, KIPP Academy, in the Bronx, with a vision that every child grows up free to create the future they want for themselves and their communities. Today, our network consists of eight elementary schools, nine middle schools, one high school, and KIPP Forward, a comprehensive program to support our students and alumni in choosing and preparing for the educational and career paths that fit their goals and sense of purpose. KIPP NYC currently serves more than 11,000 students and alumni, has a staff of more than 1,000 (11 % of whom are alumni), and continues to grow!

**Position Overview:**

KIPP NYC Special Education Teachers work closely both as a team and with General Education Teachers in order to plan targeted, high-leverage intervention for their students. Our Special Education Teachers seek first to diagnose student challenges and then to design individual programs and differentiated strategies in order to meet specific needs. The team serves students with IEPs and diagnosed disabilities, as well as with students who are identified as at-risk.

**Responsibilities:**

* Teaching a rigorous college preparatory curriculum which combines the school’s standards and the New York State standards
* Teaching students in a high-quality, exciting way
* Committing to constant professional and personal growth through working closely as part of a team of teachers
* Using data to drive decisions
* Constantly assessing student progress, and communicating results to families and colleagues
* Providing individual or small group instruction for students who need additional assistance
* Modeling a “whatever it takes” spirit to ensure that each student is successful.
* Modeling the school’s values in all communications with students, families, and staff

**Qualifications**

* Strong interpersonal skills that contribute to a collegial working environment and a healthy measure of the character traits we value: zest, grit, hope, love, social intelligence, gratitude and a sense of humor.
* At least two years of teaching experience strongly preferred
* New York State teacher certification in the appropriate content area
* Bachelor’s degree required
* A passion for being part of a team-oriented, mission-driven school culture
* A strong desire to become a better teacher by joining the KIPP NYC team and family
* Demonstrated success in raising the achievement levels of students from the communities KIPP NYC serves

**Apply Here:**

**Additional Information**  
**Compensation and Benefits:**

KIPP NYC offers a competitive salary ranging from $69,440 - $142,270 per year. Salaries are determined using an equitable compensation scale that accounts for years of experience relevant to the role, NYS initial or professional certification, and longevity within the KIPP network. KIPP NYC will evaluate a candidate’s years of experience, certification, and longevity at point of hire to determine the step/level a new hire will be placed within our teacher salary scale.

KIPP NYC offers a generous benefits package including, but not limited to, the following:

* Robust benefits that include medical, dental, and vision.
* Generous Time-Off including 5 school vacation weeks, sick and personal days, and an extended summer break.
* Up to 12 weeks 100% parental leave.
* Bright Horizon Back-up Child and Elder care.
* Employer paid Life Insurance and Short term/Long term disability.
* Employee incentives including 8 Weeks paid Sabbatical after 10 years, annual professional development funds, and tuition reimbursement.

*This description is intended to describe the type of work being performed by a person assigned to this position. It is not an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities required by the employee.*

*This role is based in NYC and will require travel to our schools. If you relocate outside of a commutable distance or out of the state of NY, your employment will be subject to review, which may include separation from KIPP NYC. It is important that you notify HR if you move or have plans to relocate.*

*KIPP NYC LLC does not offer visa sponsorship or work authorization.*

*KIPP NYC LLC is an anti-racist organization that believes in the importance of being diverse, equitable, and inclusive. We are committed to creating a welcoming environment that includes employees with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving students and families throughout New York City. BIPOC, women, gender expansive, LGBTQIA+, veterans, and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.*

*KIPP NYC LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. KIPP NYC LLC is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment.*

Pay: $69,440.00 - $142,270.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

* Special education: 2 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Teaching Certification (Preferred)

title: Executive Administrative Assistant
description:
**Position Summary:** 

The Executive Administrative Assistant plays a vital role in supporting our Operations Execution team with efficiency and professionalism. Reporting directly to the VP/Executive Director and coordinating with Area Leads and various support teams, this position requires a high degree of discretion and confidentiality. The primary responsibilities include scheduling meetings, arranging travel, and organizing daily calendars to ensure smooth operations and effective time management for senior executives.

The Executive Administrative Assistant must be proactive, deadline-oriented, and possess excellent communication skills. A keen ability to anticipate the needs of senior managers and address them promptly is essential for maintaining the seamless workflow of our company.

Ultimately, the Executive Administrative Assistant will be instrumental in ensuring the efficient and professional execution of administrative tasks, contributing significantly to the overall success of our Operations Execution team. The role demands a balance of technical skills, organizational prowess, and a commitment to maintaining the highest standards of support for our senior leadership.

**Key Responsibilities of this role:**

● Efficiently manage and coordinate the executive's calendar, scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements to optimize time and productivity.

● Anticipate and resolve scheduling conflicts, ensuring priorities are addressed and deadlines are met.

● Serve as a primary point of contact, handling all incoming communications, including emails, phone calls, and mail, with professionalism and confidentiality.

● Draft, proofread, and edit correspondence, reports, and presentations on behalf of the executive, ensuring clarity and accuracy.

● Organize and maintain confidential files, records, and documents, ensuring easy accessibility and compliance with company policies.

● Assist in the preparation of meeting agendas, recording minutes, and following up on action items to ensure timely completion.

● Support the executive in managing special projects, coordinating cross-functional teams, and tracking project milestones to ensure successful outcomes.

● Conduct research, gather data, and prepare analytical reports to support decision-making processes.

● Assist in organizing company events, meetings, and conferences, ensuring all logistical details are handled seamlessly.

● Foster a positive and collaborative work environment by acting as a liaison between the executive and other team members.

● Provide guidance and support to other administrative staff, ensuring cohesive and efficient office operations.

**Experience and Skills Required** 

● Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in an administrative role, preferably supporting senior executives.

● Proven track record of managing multiple tasks and projects simultaneously with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.

● Experience in corporate settings and familiarity with office management procedures and basic accounting principles.

● Previous roles that required confidentiality and discretion in handling sensitive information.

● Excellent Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills to interact effectively with internal and external stakeholders.

● Organizational Abilities: Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage time efficiently.

● Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and comfortable with various office software and tools.

● Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to anticipate needs, think critically, and offer solutions proactively.

● Interpersonal Skills: Strong interpersonal skills to cultivate positive relationships with colleagues and clients.

● Attention to Detail: High attention to detail and accuracy in managing schedules, preparing reports, and handling correspondence.

● Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and the ability to work well under pressure.

● Professionalism: Demonstrated professionalism and a high standard of ethical conduct.

**Core Competencies of the Role:**

● **Ensures Accountability:** Follows through on commitments and makes sure others do the same; Acts with a clear sense of ownership; Takes personal responsibility for decisions, actions and failures; Establishes clear responsibilities and processes for monitoring work and measuring results; Designs feedback loops into work.

● **Communicates Effectively:** Is effective in a variety of communication settings: one-on-one, small and large groups, or among diverse styles and position levels; Attentively listens to others; Adjusts to fit the audience and the message. Provides timely and helpful information to others across the organization. Encourages the open expression of diverse ideas and opinions.

● **Plans and Aligns**: Sets objectives to align with broader organizational goals; Breaks down objectives into appropriate initiatives and actions; Stages activities with relevant milestones and schedules; Anticipates and adjusts effective contingency plans

● **Collaborates:** Works cooperatively with others across the organization to achieve shared objectives; Represents own interests while being fair to others and their areas; Partners with others to get work done; Credits others for their contributions and accomplishments; Gains trust and support of others

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ADA:**

● Requires sitting, standing, walking, hearing, talking on the telephone, attending in-person meetings, typing, and working with paper/files, etc.

● Ability to regularly travel to multiple retail locations as needed.

● Job requires the ability to work in an office and retail environment with frequent sitting, standing, and walking as necessary.

● May occasionally be required to lift up to 50 lbs.

● Vision requirements: Ability to see information in print and/or electronically.

● Ability to tolerate refrigerated temperatures.

title: 1010 WINS Reporter
description:
Overview:

1010 WINS is looking for high-energy communicators with strong writing and storytelling skills to help engage a new generation of news consumers. If you understand that compelling writing, great storytelling, and creative use of sound make for a great news product and a great listening experience, then we want to hear from you.  

New York is one of the most diverse cities in the world; our stories reflect its people, issues, politics, and quality of life.  

Our ideal candidate will be responsible for writing and delivering compelling stories, focusing on live, breaking news coverage. You should have a 24/7 attitude towards news gathering and be able to anchor when needed. Additionally, you should be proficient in leveraging social media platforms to gather news and engage with the community. holding officials accountable for their decisions and promoting community engagement are essential aspects of this role.
If this sounds like you, then we invite you to apply.  

This is a full-time SAG-AFTRA position.
The anticipated starting salary range for New York-based individuals expressing interest in this position is $117,000.00/Yr.


Salary to be determined by the education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities and location of the applicant, as well as internal and external equity.


Audacy offers full time employees with a comprehensive benefits package to include: health care coordinator, medical, dental, vision, telemedicine, flexible spending accounts, health savings account, disability, life insurance, critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, paid time off (sick, vacation, personal, parental, volunteer), 401(k) retirement plan, discounted employee stock purchase, student loan payment assistance program, legal assistance, life assistance program, identity theft protection, discounted home and auto insurance, and pet insurance.

  


Responsibilities:
**What You'll Do:**  

* Report live from the field or studio
* Superb broadcast writing skills
* Ability to read and understand complex material and turn it into easy-to-understand copy under deadline pressure
* Gather, write, record, edit, and deliver news content
* Collaborate with newsroom staff
* Report Live Coverage of Breaking News and Special Coverage
* Interview newsmakers
* The ability to project urgency while staying calm and in control during major breaking news and to do so without a script
* Operate studio board while on air
* Connect with listeners on social and digital platforms to promote the brand
* Develop and research potential news stories
* Ability to anchor news will give candidate additional consideration
* Protect the station's FCC license
* Other duties as required by management


Qualifications: **Required & Preferred:**

  

* Candidates must demonstrate strong news judgment and must understand the powerful voice and responsibilities of our brands.
* You must be an idea-generating journalist with a positive attitude and standout work ethic.
* Candidates must demonstrate the ability to collaborate on story ideas and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Candidates must be detail-oriented and cool under the pressure of meeting tight deadlines.
* Experience in the New York Metropolitan area is a plus.
* Must be willing to work a schedule that will include holidays, nights, overnights, and/or weekends.
* A valid driver’s license, satisfactory completion of a motor vehicle record check, and, if the position requires use of applicant’s own vehicle, proof of insurance, is required.


Important Notes::

Please be aware that Audacy will **never** ask you to send money at any point during the hiring process. Communication from legitimate Audacy representatives will **only come from email addresses ending in @audacy.com**. If you receive any suspicious requests or communications, please verify their authenticity before responding.
About Us:
*Audacy, Inc. is a leading multi-platform audio content and entertainment company that connects with 200 million consumers. Powered by its exclusive, premium audio content that includes unrivaled leadership positions in news and sports radio, Audacy operates one of the country’s two scaled radio broadcasting groups, a rapidly growing direct-to-consumer digital audio platform, multiple audio networks, a major event business and a leading, award-winning podcast studio. Learn more at* *www.audacyinc.com**,* *Facebook**,* *X**,* *LinkedIn* *and* *Instagram**.*
EEO:
*Audacy is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Audacy affords equal employment opportunity to qualified individuals regardless of their race, color, religion or religious creed, sex/ gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age (over 40), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, military or veteran status, or other classification protected by applicable federal, state, or local law, and to comply with all applicable laws and regulations. Consistent with our commitment to equal employment opportunity, we provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities who need assistance in applying electronically for a position with Audacy, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship. To request a reasonable accommodation for this purpose, please call 1-610-660-5614. Please note that this phone number is to be used solely to request an accommodation with respect to the online application process. Calls for any other reason will not be returned. Reasonable accommodation requests are considered on a case-by-case basis.*

title: Head of Sales
description:
Dandy is transforming the massive ($200B) but antiquated dental industry. Backed by some of the world's leading venture capital investors, we are on an ambitious mission to integrate and simplify every function of the dental practice through technology. By building the operating system for every dental office in America, Dandy is empowering dentists with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practice, their people, and their patients.

**About the Role**


Together with our Head of Growth and the rest of the executive team, the Head of Sales will ensure revenue growth through our next stage of hyper scale. They’ll oversee a team of 70+ delivering on a multi-channel sales strategy.

**What You’ll Do**

* Manage the day-to-day execution of our Commercial sales (AE and xDR teams) ensuring the teams meet their quota, activity, and other performance-related goals
* Ensure execution and alignment across multiple office hubs
* Recruit best-in-class teams across the country and retain them with a high-performance sales culture
* Partner with the Head of Revenue, Head of Marketing, Head of Rev Ops, and other senior executives to develop our GTM strategy, plan our growth, and develop roadmaps designed to advance Dandy sales
* Strategize and build our Enterprise motion from the ground up
* Champion sales enablement and ensure all sales personnel live up to their full potential
* Lead our thinking on how to best position and sell Dandy to our dentist prospects regardless of channel
* Craft tailored strategies and tactics for our AE and xDR teams to win
* Document, best practices, operating rhythms, and other processes to ensure Dandy can continue to scale efficiently
* Become an expert on our sales metrics and maintain a clear opinion on the performance of all teams across the funnel and critical performance ratios
* Dive deep into our inbound channels and work with marketing to maximize the potential of every lead and channel
* Ensure that new business is successfully handed off to post-sales and activated on our platform sharing accountability for long-term revenue growth
* Develop our outstanding sales management team as we scale in hypergrowth and ensure career development

**What We’re Looking For**

* Proven track record of scaling sales teams in hypergrowth/start-up environments with limited supporting resources: you’ve helped “figure it out”
* You’ve developed sales management and facilitated career advancement for first-line and second-line leaders (and beyond)
* You have a proven track record of building scalable enablement, operating rhythms, and other processes to ensure the GTM org scales as efficiently as possible
* You’ve developed teams capable of going outbound and maximizing inbound across sales cycles that can vary from several days to several months
* Proven capability of designing GTM strategy and capacity plans that deliver results in ambiguous environments


We offer a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits including healthcare, dental, parental planning, mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan, and paid time off.


Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.


Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. If you require any accommodations for your interview or have any questions beforehand, rest assured that we will move at Dandy speed and do everything in our power to meet your needs.


Compensation Range: $200K - $350K

title: Manager of Technical Services
description:
Reed-Lane, Inc. a pharmaceutical contract packager located in Wayne, NJ seeks an individual with supervisory skills who can directly work on blister and bottling machines. If you like to work in an extremely fast paced environment, are familiar with these types of packaging lines and understand quality, cGMP environment then this position is for you.

***Position Details:*** The equipment experience, knowledge and supervisory skills with the mechanical team are essential to the position requirements. Specifically:

Provide Technical Support and leadership to ensure department/plant goals are met or exceeded

Manage daily staffing and effective resource allocation including labor, repair parts and outside services

Develop training programs and training of technical staff and assist in packaging suites

Interact with engineers, project managers and customers and vendors

The above are some of the position attributes. If you have knowledge of machinery especially blister lines and bottling lines; this position could be right for you.

***Benefits:*** Reed-Lane offers a competitive salary, medical and dental benefits, 401K, PTO days.

***Qualifications:*** 

Bachelor's Degree and one to two years of related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience is required.

Able to work independently and as part of the team.

Exceptional communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills.

Team leadership and facilitation skills in a technical environment

Computer (PC), data collection, and analysis skills necessary to fulfill job responsibilities

title: Associate Director of Business Development
description:
**About GameChanger:**


We believe in the life-changing impact youth sports have on and off the field because they encourage leadership, teamwork, responsibility, and confidence—important life lessons that have the power to propel our youth toward meaningful futures. We recognize that without coaches, parents, and volunteers, organized youth sports could not exist. By building the first and best place to experience the youth sports moments important to our community, we are helping families elevate the next generation through youth sports.


So if you love sports and their community-building potential, or building cool products is your sport, GameChanger is the team for you. We are a remote-first, dynamic tech company based in New York City, and we are solving some of the biggest challenges in youth sports today.

**The Position:**


The Associate Director of Business Development will play a key role in driving the growth and expansion of GameChanger’s business through unique long term revenue-generating, layered partnerships. This position requires a strategic “big picture” thinker with a flexible mindset who has a proven track record of ideating and negotiating complex deal terms and partnership structures that incorporate mutually beneficial revenue, marketing, brand and other key cross-departmental components. The Associate Director of Business Development will work closely with the Head of Business Development to identify net-new business opportunities, forge strategic internal & external relationships, negotiate partnerships and drive revenue growth.

**What You’ll Do:**

* *Partner Scoping & Vetting*


	+ Identify, prospect, scope and succinctly present business opportunities to internal stakeholders that diversify revenue while adding value to holistic GameChanger goals & objectives
	+ Lead outreach and conversations to manage the end-to-end vetting process
* *Proposal & Vision Development*


	+ Prepare and present compelling case-by-case proposals and presentations to prospective partners
	+ Customize proposed solutions and ways of working to meet specific partner and internal departmental needs
* *Deal Structures/Negotiation*


	+ Bring a clear point-of-view and suggested approach to each partnership exploration
	+ Be prepared to think strategically and differentiate deal terms by partner, components and structure/type
* *Relationship Management & Collaboration*


	+ Build and maintain strong relationships with key internal, cross-company and external stakeholders. Ensure high-levels of transparency and communication with a keen ability to tailor messaging to appropriate audiences.
	+ Work closely with the Business Development team and other departments (e.g. Go-to-Market, Brand, Data, Product, Engineering, Corporate Development/Finance, etc.) to consistently align Business Development efforts with company-wide goals and strategies.
	+ Foster a culture of transparency and continuous learning within the Business Development team and across the organization
* *Data, Reporting & Legal Processing*


	+ Develop and maintain robust data analysis and reporting systems to track the success of partnerships and inform strategic decisions.
	+ Use data-driven insights to identify opportunities, optimize current partnerships, and guide future partnership strategies.
	+ Manage the Legal Process for assigned partnership deals

**What You’ll Bring:**

* Proven ability to think strategically and a willingness to innovate as it pertains to Business Development deal structures and various ways of working
* Experience successfully managing internal and external relationships to communicate opportunities, define objectives, facilitate feedback and align on success metrics to move deals forward
* A passion for organization and clear (written & verbal) communication, ensuring concise conveyance of strategies, insights, and partnership details both internally and externally
* Strong, confident negotiation skills
* Analytical mindset with the ability to leverage data for decision-making — knowing which questions to ask specific to each partnership conversation
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Comfort with working in a fast-pace, constantly evolving environment

**Who You Are:**

* BS or BA in Business or a related discipline
* 5-7 years of professional experience, ideally with experience in Business Development or Partnerships
* Deep knowledge of complex deal terms, contract development and negotiation, go-to-market strategies, and understanding of key business and revenue-specific drivers.
* Capable and persuasive communicator both internally & externally who can make arguments clearly and succinctly, both verbally and in writing.
* Ability to form deep bonds with internal stakeholders through deeply understanding their work streams and individual priorities.
* Track-record of using data to develop business cases & review performance.
* Top-notch presentation skills: storytelling, setting frame of reference (context) and clearly communicating point of difference and value proposition.
* Experience in Youth/High School Sports Market, Media, Tech or Sports Industry (*preferred not required*)

**Perks**:

* Work remotely throughout the US\\* or from our well-furnished, modern office in Manhattan, NY.
* Unlimited vacation policy.
* Paid volunteer opportunities.
* WFH stipend - $500 annually to make your WFH situation comfortable.
* Snack stipend - $60 monthly to have snacks shipped to your home office.
* Full health benefits - medical, dental, vision, prescription, FSA/HRA., and coverage for family/dependents.
* Life insurance - basic life, supplemental life, and dependent life.
* Disability leave - short-term disability and long-term disability.
* Retirement savings - 401K plan offered through Vanguard, with a company match.
* Company paid access to a wellness platform to support mental, financial and physical wellbeing.
* Generous parental leave.
* DICK’S Sporting Goods Teammate Discount.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

*The target salary range for this position is between $150,000 and $160,000. This is part of a total compensation package that includes incentive, equity, and benefits for eligible roles. Individual pay may vary from the target range and is determined by several factors including experience, internal pay equity, and other relevant business considerations. We constantly review all teammate pay to ensure a great compensation package that is fair and equal across the board.*

* *DICK'S Sporting Goods has company-wide practices to monitor and protect us from compliance and monetary implications as it pertains to employer state tax liabilities. Due to said guidelines put in place, we are unable to hire in AK, DE, HI, IA, LA, MS, MT, OK, and SC.*


Compensation Range: $150K - $160K

title: Linen Attendant - Greenwich Hospital
description:
**Linen Attendant- Greenwich Hospital**
Unitex is experiencing unprecedented growth! Due to this growth, we are in search of a Linen Attendant for our facility at Greenwich Hospital.  

  

**Compensation:** $16.00/hr. The salary range for this position is $16.00/hour to $16.00/hour. Actual compensation decisions are based on factors such as experience, seniority, location, and other permissible job-related factors.  

  

**Duties and responsibilities (including but not limited to):**
* Distribute linens to various departments within the hospital
* Load and unload scrub machines
* Stock and restock shelves

**Required Skills:**
* MUST have flexibility to work various hours (mornings, evenings, weekends) totaling 40 hours per week
* Must be able to lift loads of linens and push carts filled with linens - approx. 300 pounds


  

This is an entry level position. No experience is required.  

  

Unitex offers a competitive compensation package including health insurance, 401K with employer matching, paid vacation, sick days, etc.  

  

Visit our website at www.unitex.com to learn more about our company and watch our recruiting video at https://youtu.be/5XgjhF0ubnw to see us in action and hear from our employees.  


EOE  


*About Unitex:*  


*For more than 100 years, our family-run business has been leading the way in the medical uniform and linen rental industry. Today, with 1900 employees and growing, we are the largest family-owned healthcare service provider in the country.*  


*Every single day, Unitex is behind the scenes cleaning, preparing and delivering the linen that helps healthcare professionals provide the best care to their patients from fresh sheets to warm blankets, comfortable gowns and clean towels.*  


*Unitex is an essential service to the healthcare industry which translates to a safe and stable workplace that makes it easy for people to apply their skills to become successful in every one of our roles. Due to our past, current and future expansions, we actively hire drivers, mechanics and production operators, clerical positions and various management and outside sales roles. All of Unitex’ s roles include competitive pay, medical benefits, PTO time and more. We are committed to training, developing and promoting our employees. Those with a solid work ethic, who are self-motivated, reliable and flexible succeed at Unitex.*  


*When it comes to stable, long-term employment with diverse growth opportunities, Unitex has it all. Join Unitex and become part of a winning team.*  


*Unitex Recruitment video:* https://youtu.be/5XgjhF0ubnw

title: Events & Program Intern
description:
**Job Description:**
The Events & Program Intern will play a critical role in supporting the planning, coordination, and execution of Animal's events and programs. This position is responsible for handling logistical details, coordinating with vendors and suppliers, and ensuring that all events are executed smoothly and efficiently. The ideal candidate will be highly organized, proactive, and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
The position will be eligible for a full-time, hybrid work schedule, with a 3 month duration. The pay range for this position will be $18-$20.  


**Key Responsibilities:**
* **Event Planning & Coordination**
	+ Assist in the planning and execution of events, including expos, trade shows, community events, and internal programs.
	+ Coordinate with vendors, suppliers, and venues to secure necessary resources and ensure timely delivery of services.
	+ Support the Events Manager in developing event timelines, schedules, and checklists.
	+ Assist in the development and management of event budgets, ensuring all expenses are tracked and reported accurately.
* **Logistics Management**
	+ Handle logistics for events, including transportation, setup, teardown, and on-site management.
	+ Coordinate the shipment and tracking of event materials, products, and equipment.
	+ Ensure that all event-related materials are prepared, packed, and delivered according to schedule.
	+ Assist in managing event registrations, RSVPs, and guest lists.
* **Communication & Coordination**
	+ Serve as a point of contact for event-related inquiries from internal teams, vendors, and participants.
	+ Communicate event details, expectations, and responsibilities clearly to all stakeholders.
	+ Provide regular updates on event status and progress to the Events Manager and other relevant teams.
* **On-Site Event Support**
	+ Assist with the on-site management of events, including coordinating staff, managing vendor relationships, and troubleshooting issues as they arise.
	+ Ensure that the event environment is welcoming, branded, and meets the high standards expected by the Animal community.
	+ Support post-event activities, including teardown, feedback collection, and reporting.
* **Administrative Support**
	+ Maintain detailed records of event logistics, vendor contracts, and budget expenses.
	+ Assist in preparing event-related documents, such as itineraries, presentations, and reports.
	+ Support the Events Manager with general administrative tasks as needed.

**Qualifications:**
* **Education & Experience**
	+ Pursuing a degree in marketing or events related role
	+ Experience in event planning, logistics, or a related role
* **Skills & Competencies**
	+ Strong organizational and time-management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines.
	+ Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
	+ Detail-oriented with a strong focus on accuracy and efficiency.
	+ Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and independently when required.
	+ Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and event management software.
	+ Ability to lift and move event materials and equipment as needed
* **Personal Attributes**
	+ Proactive and solution-oriented with a strong sense of responsibility.
	+ Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities.
	+ Passionate about health, fitness, and the Animal brand

title: Finance and Insurance Manager
description:
FINANCE & INSURANCE (F&I) Manager: The F&I Manager sells financing and insurance programs to used and new car buyers and works with lenders to give fair interest rates and programs to buyers. F&I Managers are expected to uphold the highest ethical standards of the dealership and must maintain the profitability of their department while controlling expenses and maintaining customer satisfaction. Specifically, in this role you will:  


* Oversee dealership customer loan origination and approval process.
* Establish and maintain strong relations with our lenders.
* Maintain accurate monthly, quarterly, and year-end reports.
* Determine the customer’s need for financing and explore payment options.
* Establish a positive relationship with customers as they are presented products and services.
* Present warranties, credit insurance, GAP insurance and other beneficial products offered by the dealership.
* Secure and finalize transactions in a legal and ethical manner while maintain a high level of productivity.
* Meet monthly forecast for finance and insurance income, penetration levels and customer satisfaction.
* Accurately prepare all federal, state, and dealer paperwork related to the transaction and submits to the dealership’s Accounting Department in a timely manner.
* Enhance customer satisfaction during the entire purchase experience.
* Supervise the financial services associates to ensure individual and department goals are met.
* Demonstrate behavior consistent with our company values in all interactions with customers, co-workers, and vendors.
  

WHAT WE OFFER

* Guaranteed salary plus monthly bonuses
* Mentorship & one on one training
* Comprehensive benefits program, including health care options (medical, dental and vision), Short Term Disability, Company Paid Life Insurance and 401k savings and retirement plan with company match.
* Opportunities for career growth and advancement tailored to individual performance, experience, and interests.
OUR EXPECTATIONS

* Prior experience in an automotive dealership as an F & I manager
* Proficient at operating a personal computer including Microsoft Office E-mail, Excel and Word
* Ability to work independently and be self-motivated
* Great attitude with high-energy personality
* Strong attention to detail
* Outstanding communication skills in both verbal and written
* Valid driver license

title: Influencer Management Intern
description:
**Job Description:**
The Influencer Manager Intern will support our Influencer Management team during peak season by handling logistical, communication, and coordination tasks. This role is perfect for someone passionate about social media, influencer marketing, and brand partnerships. You will work closely with our Influencer Manager to ensure smooth operations and effective communication with our influencer partners and ambassador programs
The position will be eligible for a full-time, hybrid work schedule, with a 3 month duration. The pay range for this position will be $18-$20.
**Key Responsibilities:**
* **Logistical Support**
	+ Assist in organizing and tracking influencer campaigns, ensuring all deliverables are met on time.
	+ Coordinate the shipment of products and promotional materials to influencers
	+ Manage influencer databases, updating contact information, campaign details, and performance metrics
	+ Coordinate and schedule travel and stay for influencer photo/video shoots
	+ Work with the creative team to ensure delivery of content obligations from influencers
* **Communications**
	+ Draft and send emails and other communications to influencers on behalf of the Influencer Manager
	+ Serve as a point of contact for influencers, responding to inquiries and providing support as needed
	+ Monitor and report on influencer content to ensure alignment with campaign goals and brand guidelines
* **Coordination**
	+ Schedule meetings, calls, and check-ins with influencers and internal teams
	+ Collaborate with the content creation and marketing teams to ensure timely and accurate content delivery
	+ Help plan and execute influencer events or virtual activations during peak season

**Qualifications:**
* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Marketing, Communications, Public Relations, or a related field
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines
* Strong email marketing skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Proficiency in social media platforms and an understanding of influencer marketing trends
* Experience with project management tools (e.g., Asana, Trello) is a plus
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team

title: REVES Team Member: Smoothie Barista
description:
REVES is a fast-growing startup smoothie café offering superfruit bowls, smoothies, coffees, and more with the mission to bring happiness through our products to our community. What began as the dream of a German couple has flourished into a busy downtown location in the heart of Westfield, with a dozen amazing team members, and the shared vision to push together beyond our limits.

**THE ROLE**

As a Smoothie Barista at REVES, you will be onboarded into a tailor-made training program. Your paid training will focus on preparing freshly made smoothies, açaí bowls, and coffees.

At REVES, there is plenty of room for progression. You will have the opportunity to progress into a Senior REVES Family Member or Shift Leader within six months based on your skill set and your performance. Our goal is to find the best candidate who is eager to learn and grow.

**WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

You don’t need any previous experience to join our movement, although it is a plus. If you are a hard worker, with a can-do attitude, and an eagerness to learn, we'd love to hear from you! In short, we are looking for:

* high energy, and a positive mindset
* high attention to detail - it’s the little things that make the difference
* customer focus mentality - we love our customers ♥
* ability to stand for long periods and lift up to 30lbs, but don’t worry you will be having fun

**WHAT WE ARE OFFERING**

Fast progression and an opportunity for a career. Our vision of growing REVES goes a long way with lots of room for hardworking individuals! Also:

* fun and caring working environment - we are always looking out for one another
* free drinks, and up to 50% discounts
* competitive pay: $17-$20 per hour (including tips)
* holiday pay
* bonuses: hard work will always be rewarded at REVES
* work-life balance: You work to live, not live to work ☀

**REVES EMPLOYEE VIDEO**

https://www.instagram.com/reel/Cw5NCs6Lm73/?igshid=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==

Join us at REVES and make the world a happier place one drink at a time - we are looking forward to your application!

title: Associate Director of Digital Media Communications
description:
**Job Title: Associate Director of Digital Media Communications**

**Location:** Westchester, NY  
**Reports to:** Executive Director of The Arc Westchester Foundation

**About The Arc Westchester Foundation:**

The Arc Westchester Foundation is dedicated to securing financial support for The Arc Westchester, an organization committed to empowering children and adults with developmental disabilities and their families. As we celebrate our 75th anniversary, we seek a dynamic and experienced Director of Digital Media Communications to enhance our digital outreach, communications, and overall marketing strategy.

**Job Summary:**

The Director of Digital Media Communications will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of our digital outreach and communications, including social media management, email marketing, video production, and content creation. This role requires a strong background in marketing, excellent writing and communication skills, and the ability to work independently. Experience in non-profit fundraising and familiarity with human services organizations are desirable, but not required.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement comprehensive digital and other communications strategies to increase awareness and engagement with The Arc Westchester and its mission, values, and overall messaging
* Assist in the overall management, content production, and reach expansion of The Arc Westchester's official Website: www.arcwestchester.org (Wordpress Supported). This includes writing, research, interviewing and execution of news articles and evergreen content for the website to increase the optimization of our online presence and community engagement.
* Management, development and analysis of content for all of The Arc Westchester's Social Media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Linkedln, and YouTube). Including the creation of engaging and informative graphics and video. In addition, research relevant topics, stories, and types of content that would be appealing to the agency's social media following. Both internal and 3rd party content.
* Provide support to the Community Engagement & Communications Director of the Chapter in educational, awareness campaigns, creation of photography, videography, physical and digital material for internal and community educational communications.
* Design and send email campaigns using professional email sending platforms (i.e. Campaign Monitor)
* Produce and edit videos using Adobe Premiere or a similar video editing tool.
* Design graphics and promotional/communications materials using professional design software (e.g. Photoshop, InDesign, etc).
* Write and edit content for various marketing channels, ensuring clear, engaging, and consistent messaging.
* Collaborate with other departments to support outreach and fundraising efforts.
* Monitor and report on the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and make data-driven recommendations for improvement.
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices to continuously improve our marketing efforts.
* Manage vendors whose functions relate to digital communications and outreach.
* Occasionally attend and assist at fundraising events and chapter meetings, including the PR committee of The Arc Westchester and The Arc NY
* Other duties as assigned when requested by the Executive Director, Community Engagement & Communications Director, or CEO of the Chapter

**Qualifications:**

* A strong sense of messaging – that is, the ability to cut to the core of the most salient and motivating elements of a given communication and the skill to express it engagingly
* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* 3-5 years of experience in a marketing or communications role, preferably within a non-profit or human services organization.
* Proficiency in WordPress, social media platforms, email marketing tools, and Adobe Suite (Premiere, Photoshop, InDesign).
* Excellent writing, editing, and verbal communication skills.
* Strong organizational and project management skills with the ability to work independently.
* Experience with non-profit fundraising and understanding of human services organizations is a major plus.
* Creative, strategic thinker with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

**How to Apply:**

Interested candidates should submit a resume, cover letter, and portfolio (if applicable) to bclark@arcwestchester.org with the subject line "Director of Digital Media Communications Application - [Your Name]".

The Arc Westchester Foundation is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

* Vision insurance

* Monday to Friday

* Bachelor's (Required)

* Marketing Communicationss: 3 years (Preferred)

title: Paid Social Supervisor
description:
Code3 is a full-service marketing partner, powering better performance for digital disruptors and Fortune 500 leaders alike. It provides white-glove creative, media buying, and measurement services for brands across scaled digital and audience-based media platforms. Code3's deep expertise drives business results and reveals actionable insights about customers and prospects. At a time when CEOs and CMOs are striving for greater control and transparency over marketing investments, Code3 stands out through its standards, accountability and expertise. That's why top companies rely on Code3 to reach their most valuable prospects across digital, social, and emerging channels like audio and OTT.



The Paid Social Supervisor is responsible for managing a team to deliver against paid social strategies, plans and buys against a portfolio of clients. This individual is the key strategic leader on their assigned accounts and supports both strategists and hands-on keyboard experts to deliver client results. Operational excellence, strategic vision, and process orientation are key skills individuals in this role possess. The primary functions of this supervisory role is to be a subject matter expert in paid social across market-leading and emerging platforms, to provide their team with the appropriate resources (trainings, tools, processes, etc.) to deliver against client paid social media goals, to hone in on growth and development of their team, and to collaborate with social team leadership on driving best practices, critical perspectives, and overall social POVs for Code3.


***Note: This position will be required to attend in-person meetings with the client at their office in New York City a few times a month. Due to this, we are only considering candidates based full-time within the New York City area for this specific opportunity. Outside of the required in-person meetings, this is a work from home position.***


**What you'll do**:


* Leads establishing and evolving paid social strategy across their clients including, but not limited to Learning Agendas, A/B Testing & Implementations, Pixel Tagging & Event Management, client KPI and goal setting, and campaign & audience optimizations
* Trains their team in media planning and forecasting best practices, campaign architecture and build best practices, optimization of campaigns, and reporting and analysis of campaigns to drive efficiency through stronger, more strategic optimizations
* Helps to build and lead a team that delivers unbeatable paid social strategies and ad performance, inclusive of training, process enforcement, and innovation
* Showcases team leadership by problem solving and creating solutions for the Paid Social team through identifying new process efficiencies and areas of opportunity
* Attends in-person client and partner presentations and events


**Who will love this role**:


* Passion for fashion, beauty and/or luxury brands
* A data-driven decision-maker passionate about exceeding client expectations
* A people person that enjoys close relationships with your team, partners and clients


**You should have**:


* 6+ years of proven experience in developing paid social media plans, strategic presentations, and client buy-in of strategies. Must have at least 4 years of paid social buying experience
* Deep understanding of latest paid social product offerings and trends across social media platforms including Meta, TikTok, Snapchat, Pinterest, YouTube, X, and LinkedIn
* Ability to lead a team by setting paid social strategy and direction and delegating work appropriately across their team
* Excellent senior-level client presentation abilities
* Experience serving as an escalation point for clients, supporting with fire drills, strategic guidance, and growth
* Excel skills: comfort with pivot tables is a must
* Experience in managing a team is a must
* Certifications in digital marketing and/or social media strategy are a plus (Meta Blueprint Buying and Planning Certifications, Snap Focus, Google Analytics Certification, etc.)
* Experience with luxury, fashion, and/or beauty brands is a plus


**Perks and Benefits**:


* Full medical and dental benefits and generous retirement program
* Thoughtful parental leave and staggered return program
* Flexible Time Off, holidays, quarterly Company "Recharge" Days, and holiday closure in December
* Ongoing learning and development opportunities
* Commitment to transparent DE&I practices


Code3's people are what set us apart. We're dedicated to hiring, retaining, and developing a diverse group of remarkable Coders because we know it's the way things should be. By prioritizing our commitment to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and safe environment, we are living our mission of fueling the growth of our people. It's this focus that empowers Coders to not only achieve great work for our clients, but also propel their own development forward and upward. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds and all identities to apply even if you don't feel that you meet all of the requirements above!



If you have any special needs that we can accommodate, please reach out to our team at recruiting@code3.com so we can make accommodations.



Salary Information: The base salary range for this position is $104,500 - $117,500 and is commensurate with candidate experience and location. Position also offers a bonus based on company and client success.


*For candidates that are based in California, we encourage you to review this important information for California residents* *here**. For best results, open the link in a new tab.*

title: Associate Manager, Sales and Partnerships
description:
**About Us:**
-------------



Rent the Runway (RTR) is transforming the way we get dressed by pioneering the world's first Closet in the Cloud. Founded in 2009, RTR has disrupted the $2.4 trillion fashion industry by inspiring women with a more joyful, sustainable and financially-savvy way to feel their best every day. As the ultimate destination for circular fashion, the brand now offers infinite points of access to its shared closet via a fully customizable subscription to fashion, one-time rental or ownership. RTR offers designer apparel, accessories and home decor from 700+ brand partners and has built in-house proprietary technology and a one-of-a-kind reverse logistics operation. Under CEO and Co-Founder Jennifer Hyman's leadership, RTR has been named to CNBC's "Disruptor 50" five times in ten years, and has been placed on Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies list multiple times, while Hyman herself has been named to the "TIME 100" most influential people in the world and as one of People magazine's "Women Changing the World."


**About the Job:**
------------------



Rent the Runway's two-sided discovery engine is a modern way for brands and retailers to reach the engaged, fashion-focused US consumer—customers are finding new brands they love, and brand partners are finding new customers they want.



We're hiring a **Sales and Partnerships Associate**to support new partnership initiatives such as our in-bag sampling program, a paid opportunity for companies to include brand samples or marketing materials in RTR outbound shipments to get in the hands and homes of our core customer, and to effectively grow and maintain our sales pipeline on a go-forward basis. This role willsit within the Marketing organization, supporting our Manager of Advertising Partnerships**,** and will serve as thevery important connection between RTR and the consumer brands with whom we partner. We're looking for someone who has experience in sales development, lead generation, and is a pro at working cross-functionally across an organization.


**What You'll Do:**


* Identify and strategically source revenue-generating opportunities with potential partners including mass and prestige beauty brands, direct-to-consumer brands and other relevant consumer product goods companies
* Support RTR's in-bag sampling program and sales cycle including creating sales materials, scheduling sales calls, executing contracts, and managing campaign flights
* Ideate internally and externally on launching new campaigns and advertising offerings that will drive incremental revenue for the business
* After a deal is closed, manage the end-to-end execution of bringing it to life, including liaising with RTR marketing team, handling all relevant communications and owning detailed campaign logistics.
* Build high-quality presentations and decks that effectively support strategic sales initiatives


**About You:**


* You have a Bachelor's degree and 2+ years prior experience in sales, business development or partnerships role - you will need to juggle multiple partnerships and projects simultaneously
* You are a creative problem solver and have the ability to think outside the box and develop innovative solutions to overcome sales challenges, adapt to changing circumstances, and meet customer needs effectively.
* You have a familiarity with brands - you've worked with external brands through partnerships or a client-facing role and understand how their priorities and budgets work
* You are goal-oriented and thrive in a results-driven environment - you perform best when you're given autonomy and accountability
* You have strong interpersonal skills, as as well as the ability to work cross-functionally across internal teams
* You are highly organized. You possess exceptional organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple sales activities, prioritize tasks effectively, and maintain meticulous records
* You bring a positive, "get it done" attitude - scrappiness is a virtue at RTR
* You are proficient in G Suite, Slack, and Zoom

  


**Benefits:**



At Rent the Runway, we're committed to the wellbeing of our employees, and aim to create a workplace that fosters both personal and professional growth. Our inclusive benefits include, but are not limited to:


* Paid Time Off including vacation, paid bereavement, and family sick leave - every employee needs time to take care of themselves and their family.
* Universal Paid Parental Leave for both parents + flexible return to work program - because we know your newest family member(s) deserve your undivided attention.
* Paid Sabbatical after 5 years of continuous service - Unplug, recharge, and have some fun!
* Exclusive employee subscription and rental discounts - to ensure you experience the magic of renting the runway (and give us valued feedback!).
* Comprehensive health, vision, dental, FSA and dependent care from day 1 of employment - Your health comes first and we've got you covered.
* 401k match - an investment in your future.
* Company wide events and outings - our team spirit is no joke - we know how to have fun!
* Office centric work - our corporate employees and technical leaders have the option to work remotely on Fridays, in accordance with Company policies.


*Rent the Runway is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with applicable law, we prohibit discrimination against any applicant or employee based on any legally-recognized basis, including, but not limited to: race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, lactation, childbirth or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, age (40 and over), national origin or ancestry, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including testing and characteristics), veteran status, uniformed service member status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.*



\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_

  



The anticipated base salary for this position is $65,000 to $80,000. The actual base salary offered will depend on a variety of factors, including without limitation, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held.

  

By submitting your application below, you agree that you have read and acknowledge Rent the Runway's Candidate Privacy Policy, found here.
