title: Retail - Assistant Store Manager
description:
Unity. Loyalty. Advancement. Charity. It’s what drives United Legwear & Apparel Co. to be the best global designer, manufacturer, and distributor of legwear, bodywear, apparel, and accessories. Founded in 1998 by Isaac E. Ash to make the very best legwear on the market, ULAC is an industry leader offering a full range of products for babies, kids, teens, and adults. We strive to sell our products at affordable prices for families. Hard work and exponential growth year on year have transformed ULAC into a global apparel and accessories company.


Our goal to deliver superior products that ensure superior customer satisfaction is made possible by our team of dedicated professionals who work together to make the company the best in business. Our manufacturing, distribution, and logistics division produces the highest quality products at the best possible prices without cutting corners. The integrity of goods is key, so compliance and quality assurance are top priorities, along with meeting every delivery date—whether shipping across the state or around the world.


We strive to foster an inclusive company culture that stands united to accomplish our mission. We are loyal to our people, supporting their development and ability to achieve excellence. We believe that when people bring their personal best to work each day, it leads to success, advancement, and upward mobility for all. We believe every individual has two hands: one to help themself, and one to help others. We pride ourselves in our value of charity and the commitments we make to help people in need. ULAC supports organizations that help those compromised by sickness, poverty, natural disasters, socioeconomic inequality, and other dire circumstances.


If you share our vision of delivering superior products in a culture of growth, excellence, and caring, then we want to hear from you!


For more information about United Legwear & Apparel Co., please visit: https://www.unitedlegwear.com  

  

Job Summary  

The Assistant Store Manager at United Legwear & Apparel Company plays a crucial role in supporting the Store Manager at the Ted Baker - Bloomingdales Concession shops in the overall operation of the store. This position is responsible for driving sales, ensuring exceptional customer service, and managing daily operations. The Assistant Store Manager leads by example, fostering a positive work environment, motivating the team, and ensuring that company standards are consistently met. This role involves overseeing staff, managing inventory, and ensuring that all operational processes are followed efficiently. The ideal candidate is a proactive leader with strong organizational skills, a passion for retail, and a commitment to excellence.  

  

Essential Functions (including but not limited to):  

*People*

* Work in partnership with the Store Manager to drive excellence within the location.
* Work with integrity and respect for others; promoting excellent team participation and ensuring the team and location are presented to the highest standards.
* Take ownership of your personal learning to enhance your development, positively impacting on that of the team and location.
* Be responsible for consistent training and standards. Deliver other company trainings to ensure the team are up to date and knowledgeable.
* Be proactive in developing and coaching others and have a flexible but consistent approach to differing people and situations.
* Execute consistent training and standards. Support the delivery of all Company trainings to ensure the team are up to date and knowledgeable.
* Confidently provide feedback on team performance to the Store Manager, District Manager and HR Team when required.
* Display high levels of personal motivation and use effective incentives to inspire and drive the team.
* Support the Store Manager to identify and resolve recruitment needs, through effective succession planning and networking.
* Support the Store Manager with the onboarding of new hires and new to position team members.
* Develop strategic partnerships and maintain productive relationships with host store partners.

*Product** Use all available tools and information to keep up to date on current product and be proficient in product details such as Called, Color, Composition, Cost, Care, Cut (The 6 Cs).
* Display up to date product knowledge such as, key trends and location bestsellers to educate team members on how to maximize sales and increase customer loyalty to the brand.
* Responsible for communicating and ensuring implementation of merchandising guidelines, replenishment procedures and housekeeping standards to ensure that Ted is always represented at the highest level.
* Partner with the Store Manager to communicate store product needs, influencing action to enhance performance.

*Commercial*

* Be responsible for maximizing sales potential and ensuring the team are expertly delivering Ted’s trainings.
* Be responsible for ensuring the team are demonstrating Greet, Observe, Talk, Fit, Assist, Thank, (GOTFAT) with enthusiasm and consistency, understanding the impact of actions on the customer experience and sales.
* Partner with the Store Manager to deliver and effective sales environment through a strong understanding of local and customer profiles and shopping behaviors.
* Responsible for driving the team to achieve the location’s performance plans and KPIs.
* Assist with managing the controllable elements of the store’s profit and loss budgets.
* Coach team members to deliver an effective and natural approach to sales, aligned with our brand.
* Support the location’s B-connected performance, promoting the use of database building and clienteling results.
* Support marketing opportunities within the brand guidelines and drive the success of all brand promotions.
* Build and maintain a strong commercial awareness of our competitors and local markets communicating findings to the Store Manager.
* Analyze relevant tools to convey a high level of commercial understanding, identifying opportunities to positively affect location performance.
* Comprehensive knowledge and interpretation of location actuals, plans and KPIs.

*Operations** Demonstrate excellent awareness and time management of all communications and directives.
* Appropriately delegate tasks ensuring they are completed on time and in line with company policy and procedures.
* Responsible for supporting team knowledge of company health and safety procedures. Use equipment properly and immediately report any potentially unsafe conditions.
* Responsible for supporting team knowledge and implementation of all loss prevention measures and protecting the assets of the company by immediately reporting any misuse or theft of Company property to the Manager/District Manager.
* Accountable for accurate cash handling and banking procedures highlighting and resolving discrepancies as a matter of priority as outlined by your host store.
* Deliver all daily operations in line with the brand's operating policies and procedures


Qualifications/Requirements:* Experience as a Department Manager/Floor Manager or in a similar role within the retail industry, preferably in fashion.
* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Excellent communication and customer service abilities.
* Ability to analyze sales data and develop effective strategies.
* Knowledge of visual merchandising and inventory management.
* Ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.


Physical Demands and Working Conditions:  

The physical demands and working conditions outlined below are representative of those required for this role to effectively perform the essential job functions. Reasonable accommodations that do not cause undue hardship may be provided to enable individuals with disabilities to fulfill these requirements. This role will be performed at a retail store location in a fast-paced, customer-facing, and bustling environment with varying noise levels which often include periods of high noise levels throughout the workday.
  

  

In this role employees are regularly expected to walk and stand for extended periods, frequently use their hands for tasks involving handling, feeling, pushing, and reaching for company products, type and manipulate electronic systems, and engage in regular communication with customers, staff, and third parties, including speaking and listening activity. This role can also include stooping, kneeling, crouching, or crawling, as necessary. The ability to lift, pull, push and/or move up to 40 pounds is required. Vision abilities for close and distance viewing related to electronic systems and/or physical products are also required. Working conditions may involve dynamic changes in pace and activity level, necessitating flexibility and promptness to perform tasks in various physical positions.  

  

This is an onsite position at our Ted Baker, Short Hills - Bloomingdales location.

title: Outbound Sales Representative
description:
**Job Title: Outbound Sales Representative**

**Location**: Brooklyn, New York (Hybrid)

**Job Type**: Full-Time

Deco Planters is a leading manufacturer of high-quality aluminum and Corten steel planters, edging, pergolas and other landscaping products for various commercial and residential applications.

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Outbound Sales Representative to join our team at Deco Planters. As an **Outbound Sales Representative**, you will be responsible for generating new business leads through heavy outbound calling, targeting construction and landscaping companies across the West Coast.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Make outbound calls to construction and landscaping companies to promote Deco Planters' products and services
* Build relationships with decision-makers and key stakeholders to identify new sales opportunities
* Presenting and sending follow up materials to prospects and existing customers
* Identify and pursue new business leads, generating high-quality leads and converting them into sales
* Meet or exceed monthly sales targets and quotas
* Stay up-to-date on market trends, product knowledge, and industry developments to effectively communicate with customers and identify new sales opportunities
* Collaborate with other departments, including Marketing and Operations, to ensure effective sales strategies and promotions

**Requirements:**

* 2+ years of experience in sales or a related field, preferably in an outbound calling environment
* Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities
* Comfortable with technology and able to navigate CRM software
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

**Compensation:**

* Base salary plus commission.

Job Type: Full-time

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* Do you have a reliable phone and internet connection for remote work?

Experience:

* Outbound sales: 2 years (Required)
* CRM software: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Brooklyn, NY 11201

title: Operations Supervisor | Full Time
description:
**Join Our House**
------------------



Mint House offers tailored residential hospitality; Apartment-style hotel, combing the comforts of home with the convenience of a hotel.



Designed for today's modern traveler, our apartment-style, tech-enabled spaces are committed to bleisure travelers. Each Mint House property is thoughtfully crafted to reflect a modern aesthetic and sustainable practices, capturing unique charm of each city. Located in vibrant major downtown hubs including New York, Miami, Nashville, Philadelphia, and Dallas, Mint House offers all the essentials for routine living on the road.



Founded in 2017, Mint House has raised approximately $85M from leading venture capital firms including Mohari Hospitality and Revolution Ventures. Discover more about our innovative approach to hospitality at minthouse.com and follow @staymint on Instagram.

  



**THE ROLE**



Mint House is seeking a highly motivated and energetic Operations Supervisor to join our ground team. As an Operations Supervisor, you will play a crucial role in ensuring our guests have an exceptional experience during their stay. This individual will work closely with our Market Lead & Operations Manager to provide travelers with what they expect and ensure Mint House standards and cleanliness operations are met.This is a fantastic opportunity for someone looking to gain valuable hospitality experience and contribute to revolutionizing the hotel experience for modern business travelers.


**AT MINT HOUSE YOU WILL**


* Respond promptly to guest requests, issues, and other outreach in real-time to deliver a seamless and delightful experience to our guests
* Conduct arrival inspections and unit departure checks to ensure that all apartments consistently meet or exceed Mint House's brand standards
* Act as a helpful resource in the field to troubleshoot guest issues in real-time and promptly report any guest maintenance concerns or issues during a guest's Mint House stay
* Foster a guest-centric culture to drive exceptional results and create a positive and welcoming environment
* Ensure all guest areas and apartments are well-maintained and inspect appliances and amenities to verify their cleanliness and proper functioning for our guests' comfort
* Master our software systems to assist guests with their stay, reservations, and communication amongst the team effectively
* Assist with cleaning and servicing assigned apartments or areas according to Mint House standards
* Perform preventative and repair maintenance work to ensure that our property is well-maintained, adhering to established quality and sustainability standards, all while treating our guests in a warm and friendly manner
* Replace basic electrical fixtures, handle minor plumbing tasks, and assist with furniture assembly to keep our property in top-notch condition
* Ensure apartments are restocked with various items and support and perform housekeeping duties when needed


**WE ARE LOOKING FOR**


* A minimum of 2 years of experience working in hospitality and/or a customer-facing environment, demonstrating your ability to provide exceptional guest service
* Willingness to work a flexible schedule to assist with staffing coverage in case of call-outs and openness to working evenings and weekends
* Strong multitasking and organizational skills with significant attention to detail to ensure a seamless guest experience
* Understanding the importance of creating a meaningful experience and bringing that spirit to our guests, ensuring their satisfaction
* Embody Mint House's core values of being gritty, adaptable, and stress-tolerant, contributing to a positive and resilient work environment
* Demonstrated honesty, reliability, and ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team
* Confidence to take charge and effectively problem solve when needed to address guest needs and concerns
* Comfortable with tech-forward thinking and the use of mobile applications and business systems to enhance guest experiences
* Energy and dedication. Mint House is transforming the traditional hotel model and defining a new category of residential hospitality. The Mint House team believes deeply in this mission and invests the time, energy and effort needed to make it a reality.


**Hourly rate is $32.00 USD.**


Mint Houses' compensation philosophy is driven by our company value of fostering inclusivity. To best ensure pay equity, we typically bring in fresh mints near the middle of our listed compensation bands and lead with the best overall compensation package (i.e. all people hired at the same experience & level are brought in at the same salary, equity, and benefits). Our Talent team will work with you and can provide more details on our philosophy.



Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.



Mint House is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a workplace of belongingness. We're committed to diversity and maintaining a work environment that is free from harassment and discrimination. Applicants from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of any protected status under federal, state, or local law.



New York City is where we call home, and you'll find HQs near Grand Central at 450 Lexington Ave, right within a WeWork space. No matter where our team members are located, we work on East Coast hours to foster collaboration, communication, and enjoy some lively emoji exchanges. At Mint House, we pause amidst the hustle to celebrate our wins, celebrating personal and company achievements via Slack. Embracing individuality, we honor each person and property, encouraging authenticity.



 Mint House participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.



Right To Work



E-Verify (English / Spanish)



 At Mint House, we are committed to promoting work-life integration in the most natural and enjoyable way possible. That's why we're excited to offer our team members complimentary nights at any Mint House location of their choice, plus exclusive year-round discounts. It's our way of ensuring that our employees can experience firsthand the comfort and convenience we champion. Enjoy your stay on us and see just how we blend work, life, and play at Mint House!

title: Account Sales Executive II
description:
**Company Description:**  

Unity. Loyalty. Advancement. Charity. It’s what drives United Legwear & Apparel Co. to be the best global designer, manufacturer, and distributor of legwear, bodywear, apparel, and accessories. Founded in 1998 by Isaac E. Ash to make the very best legwear on the market, ULAC is an industry leader offering a full range of products for babies, kids, teens, and adults. We strive to sell our products at affordable prices for families. Hard work and exponential growth year on year has transformed ULAC into a global apparel and accessories company.


Our goal to deliver superior products that ensure superior customer satisfaction is made possible by our team of dedicated professionals who work together to make the company the best in business. Our manufacturing, distribution, and logistics division produces the highest quality products at the best possible prices without cutting corners. Integrity of goods is key, so compliance and quality assurance are top priorities, along with meeting every delivery date—whether shipping across the state or around the world.


We strive to foster an inclusive company culture that stands united to accomplish our mission. We are loyal to our people, supporting their development and ability to achieve excellence. We believe that when people bring their personal best to work each day, it leads to success, advancement, and upward mobility for all. We believe every individual has two hands: one to help themself, and one to help others. We pride ourselves in our value of charity and the commitments we make to help people in need. ULAC supports organizations that help those compromised by sickness, poverty, natural disasters, socioeconomic inequality, and other dire circumstances.


If you share our vision of delivering superior products in a culture of growth, excellence, and caring, then we want to hear from you!


For more information about United Legwear & Apparel Co., please visit: https://www.unitedlegwear.com

**Job Summary:**  

The Account Sales Executive is responsible for total account management. This position oversees the product preparation and proposal, sell-in, account administration and order transaction. This Account Sales Executive position requires tangential coordination with Logistics, Order Management, Production and Merchandising to maximize the commercialization and brand management by the retailer. The Account Sales Executive will report into the Vice President of Sales.  

  

**Essential Functions (Including but not limited to):*** Understand annual sales goals and establish plan to achieve.
* Promotes and grow the brands/ categories in both existing accounts and new accounts.
* Send ATS every Monday to capture weekly OTB/ in season opportunities.
* Secure and manage all bulks/ buys/ cost requests and art requests withing all respective departments and see thru to completion.
* Review selling weekly and speak to buyers consistently.
* Segment opportunities and in season builds in conjunction with their team and the customer needs.
* Comprehension of competitive price points and weekly best sellers by season/ category.
* Identify new opportunities to gain incremental sales.
* Actively use all Marketing tools, imagery, social platforms, in store promotions.
* Negotiate positioning within the floor by account to manage sell in IMU% to leverage less MDA at End of season.
* Meet with planning team monthly or weekly on as needed basis and form liaison to retailers planning team.
* Travel/ ZOOM to accounts regularly, secure market appointments, and initiate timely follow up and next steps.
* Run NSR + open order report daily to keep order book clean.
* Request extensions as needed and make substitutions to mitigate any loss of sales.
* Understand YTD sales vs monthly budget and target sales goals needed.
* Ensure Sales Coordinators have met with sales support to ensure all orders and dates are bucketed correctly in our system.
* Manage Sales Coordinator and ensure they are checking customer orders for correct data. i.e. costing/wholesale price, units, terms, ship windows and bulks.
* Provide weekly account updates to team leaders and mgt. Perform any other duties as assigned in support of the company's needs and operations.

**Qualifications/Requirements:*** Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education or experience.
* 6 years of sales experience exceeding quotas.
* Proficient computer skills to include Microsoft Office (intermediate to advanced Excel) and database systems.
* Strong business judgment and sense of urgency and can work independently under critical time frames and work on multiple assignments.
* Excellent negotiation and leadership skills.
* Excellent written and verbal skills with the necessary interpersonal skills to deal with various individuals and clients.

title: Medical Scribe - Saddle Brook, NJ
description:
**Opportunities with Riverside Medical Group**. Discover what it means to be part of a top - rated, premier medical practice with a deep commitment to serving its community for over 35 years. We’re also part of the best hospital system in New Jersey and one of the best 50 hospitals in the nation. **Riverside Medical Group** has over 25 locations in Northern New Jersey, and we deliver quality-focused care to patients of all ages. We recently became part of **OptumCare** - the health care delivery part of **Optum**, backed by the scale and resources of the **UnitedHealth Group** family of companies. Every day we provide the ultimate patient experience through round - the - clock access to health care teams, same day and walk-in appointments, as well as charitable giving and a foundation that supports scholarships and medical research. At Riverside, you’ll play an important role in helping people achieve optimal health, and that’s just the start. Learn more about career opportunities with **Riverside Medical Group**, where you can help change the world as you do **your life's best work.****SM**


**Riverside Medical Group** is the premier medical practice in New Jersey serving patients in Hudson, Bergen, Passaic, Essex, Middlesex, Burlington, and Camden counties. We have over 60 locations and 180 board certified medical providers specializing in Adult Medicine, Pediatrics, ENT, Foot & Ankle, Gastroenterology, Rheumatology, Cardiology, Behavioral Health, Physical Therapy, Allergy & Immunology, Developmental Health, Pain Management, Chiropractic, and Optometry.



As a National Committee for Quality Assurance "Level III - Patient Centered Medical Home," Riverside is able to provide patient - focused precision medical care to the entire family and is committed to providing patients with the highest quality medical care.  

In addition to providing the highest quality of care, Riverside offers its patients the best hours of operation of any private practice in the country. Patients have around - the - clock access to a health - care team and have the benefit of same day and walk in appointments. As an advocate for prenatal health and education, Riverside offers prenatal classes every weekend free of charge. Riverside believes in giving back to their community and the patients they serve through health fairs, charitable giving / foundation, and free medical education.



As a part of the **OptumCare** network, **Riverside Medical Group** is seeking a **Medical Scribe** to join our growing team in New Jersey. At **Optum**, we are transforming healthcare nationally while providing physician - led care locally. Work with the largest care delivery organization in the world and start doing **your life's best work.****SM**



This position is full-time, Monday - Friday. Employees are required to work our normal business hours of 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM (8:00 AM - 4:00 PM on Mondays & Tuesdays, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM on Wednesdays & Thursdays, 8:00 AM - 2:00 PM on Fridays). Our office is located at 299 Market Street, Saddle Brook, NJ, 7663.



We offer 2 - 3 days of paid on-the-job training in the office. The hours of the training will be aligned with your schedule or will be discussed on your first day of employment.


**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Accurately transcribe dictations provided by healthcare professionals (e.g., physicians, nurse practitioners, or physician assistants)
* Maintain adherence to transcription quality assurance standards (e.g., QA metrics, productivity metrics, daily reviews of post - QA reports)
* Provide post - QA documents (e.g., difference documents) to transcriptionists and / or QA analysts, as appropriate
* Demonstrate appropriate grammar, punctuation and style standards when transcribing / editing provider dictations  

Demonstrate knowledge of anatomy, physiology and pharmacology
* Demonstrate knowledge of medical terminology for appropriate medical specialties
* Demonstrate knowledge of medical / surgical procedures and equipment for appropriate medical specialties
* Demonstrate knowledge of medications / dosages for appropriate medical specialties


You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* High School Diploma / GED
* Must be 18 years of age OR older
* 6+ months of medical transcription experience
* Understanding of medical terminology from education OR previous on-the-job training
* Ability to work any shift between the hours of 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM (8:00 AM - 4:00 PM on Mondays & Tuesdays, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM on Wednesdays & Thursdays, 8:00 AM - 2:00 PM on Fridays) from Monday - Friday


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Work experience as a medical scribe in a fast - paced clinical environment
* Ability to type at the speed of 60+ WPM (words per minute)
* Experience with Epic EMR


**New Jersey Residents Only:** The hourly range for this is $16.54 - $32.55 per hour. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.


*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location, and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups, and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  


*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*


*UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*

title: RN - Behavioral Health - T4 - Per Diem #42
description:
**Who We Are:**


St. John’s Episcopal Hospital is the only hospital providing emergency and ambulatory care to the densely populated, culturally and economically diverse, and medically underserved populations of the Rockaways and Five Towns in southern Queens County and southwestern Nassau County, New York. Celebrating over 110 years of community care, the 257-bed facility provides people of all faiths with comprehensive preventive, diagnostic treatment and rehabilitative services, regardless of ability to pay.


**Come Grow With Us!**


**Type:** Per Diem


**Shift:** Varies


**Hours:** Varies


**Pay:** $47.85 - $65.69 per hour, depending on education and years of experience. Shift differentials apply.

  


**Job Summary:**


* Coordinates a patient-focused team in providing direct and collaborative health care in a variety of clinical settings designed to promote and restore optimal health across the life span.
* . Utilizes all components of the nursing process in providing care that reflects an understanding of individual cultural and religious diversities and needs, and recognition of patient rights.

title: Retail - Sales Advisor
description:
Unity. Loyalty. Advancement. Charity. It’s what drives United Legwear & Apparel Co. to be the best global designer, manufacturer, and distributor of legwear, bodywear, apparel, and accessories. Founded in 1998 by Isaac E. Ash to make the very best legwear on the market, ULAC is an industry leader offering a full range of products for babies, kids, teens, and adults. We strive to sell our products at affordable prices for families. Hard work and exponential growth year on year have transformed ULAC into a global apparel and accessories company.


Our goal to deliver superior products that ensure superior customer satisfaction is made possible by our team of dedicated professionals who work together to make the company the best in business. Our manufacturing, distribution, and logistics division produces the highest quality products at the best possible prices without cutting corners. The integrity of goods is key, so compliance and quality assurance are top priorities, along with meeting every delivery date—whether shipping across the state or around the world.


We strive to foster an inclusive company culture that stands united to accomplish our mission. We are loyal to our people, supporting their development and ability to achieve excellence. We believe that when people bring their personal best to work each day, it leads to success, advancement, and upward mobility for all. We believe every individual has two hands: one to help themself, and one to help others. We pride ourselves in our value of charity and the commitments we make to help people in need. ULAC supports organizations that help those compromised by sickness, poverty, natural disasters, socioeconomic inequality, and other dire circumstances.


If you share our vision of delivering superior products in a culture of growth, excellence, and caring, then we want to hear from you!


For more information about United Legwear & Apparel Co., please visit: https://www.unitedlegwear.com  

  

**Job Summary**  

United Legwear is looking for an enthusiastic and customer-focused Sales Advisor to join our team at our Ted Baker Bloomingdale's Chestnut Hill location. The Sales Advisor will be responsible for delivering exceptional customer service, driving sales, and upholding the Ted Baker brand's high standards. The ideal candidate will have a passion for fashion, excellent communication skills, and a commitment to providing an outstanding shopping experience.  

  

**Essential Functions (including but not limiting to)**:

***People**** A high level of team participation, working with integrity and respect for others.
* Actively drive and document your own learning to contribute to the success of the team and location.
* Be adaptable and flexible to the needs of the business in support of the team and the location.
* Develop strategic partnerships and maintain productive relationships with host store partners.

***Product**** Use all available Ted’s trainings, tools and information to keep up to date on current product and increase awareness of the product in terms such as Called, Color, Composition, Cost, Care, Cut (The 6 C’s.)
* Use product knowledge to generate sales and increase customer loyalty to the brand.
* Follow merchandising guidelines, replenishment procedures and housekeeping standards to ensure that Ted is represented at the highest level.
* Support the management team with executing visual merchandising directives.

***Commercial**** Demonstrate all requirements of Ted’s trainings and standards.
* Delivering Greet, Observe, Talk, Fit, Assist Thank (GOTFAT) with enthusiasm and consistency while understanding the impact of actions on the customer experience and sales.
* Have a good understanding of local and customer profiles and use of sales techniques in order to build loyal customer relationships.
* Actively seek knowledge and take personal ownership of achieving and exceeding location KPI’s and supporting all brand promotions and initiatives.
* Drive B-connected performance by promoting the use of database building and clienteling.
* Have a strong commercial awareness of our competitors and local markets.

***Operations**** Be proactive and complete all tasks correctly and efficiently following Company policies and procedures with an ability to work unsupervised.
* Adhere to all Company health and safety procedures. Use equipment properly and report any potentially unsafe conditions to management.
* Adhere to all loss prevention measures and protect the assets of the Company by immediately reporting any misuse or theft of Company property to the Manager.
* Accountable for accurate cash handling and banking procedures highlighting and resolving discrepancies as a matter of priority as outlined by your host store.

**Qualifications/Requirements:*** Previous experience in a retail sales role, preferably in fashion.
* Strong customer service skills with a passion for providing a high-quality shopping experience.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
* Basic understanding of sales principles and customer service practices.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks and remain organized in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle customer inquiries and issues professionally.
* Flexibility to work various shifts, including weekends and holidays.
* Enthusiasm for fashion and a keen interest in the Ted Baker brand.
* High school diploma or equivalent; additional education in fashion or retail management is a plus.

**Physical Demands and Working Conditions**  

The physical demands and working conditions outlined below are representative of those required for this role to effectively perform the essential job functions. Reasonable accommodations that do not cause undue hardship may be provided to enable individuals with disabilities to fulfill these requirements. This role will be performed at a retail store location in a fast-paced, customer-facing, and bustling environment with varying noise levels which often include periods of high noise levels throughout the workday. In this role employees are regularly expected to walk and stand for extended periods which will occur on a daily basis, as well as frequently use their hands during their workday for tasks involving handling, feeling, pushing, and reaching for company products. This role requires regular typing and manipulation of electronic systems, and a primary role of this position is to engage in regular communication with customers, staff, and third parties, including speaking and listening actively throughout the workday with others in a professional manner. This role will also include stooping, kneeling, crouching, or crawling, as necessary. The ability to lift, pull, push, and/or move up to 50 pounds is required. Vision abilities for close and distance viewing related to electronic systems and/or physical products are also required on a regular basis. Working conditions may involve dynamic changes in pace and activity level, necessitating flexibility and promptness to perform tasks in various physical positions.  

  

This is an onsite retail position at our Roosevelt Field Mall - Bloomingdales location.

title: Studio Host New York
description:
**POSITION: Studio Host New York**  

**REPORTING TO: Studio Manager**  

**SALARY - $20 per hour**

 **RESPONSIBLE FOR:** Planning and scheduling of workout bookings and the first point of contact for the customer, offering 5 service and maximising every sales opportunity through rebooks and retail sales

**LOCATION: FaceGym Studio**  

FaceGym is the first of its kind and a unique facial fitness experience, and is in the confidence-boosting business. Think of us as a complete gym workout for your face. We combine powerful kneading movements with our high-performance skincare, innovative tools and cutting-edge technology to tone and tighten the 40+ forgotten muscles of the face - in our studio, on face-gym.com and at home. We are based in central London, working across the UK & USA, with new markets to launch soon!

 **Job Summary**  

The purpose of this role is to co-ordinate the scheduling and re-bookings of facial Workout appointments, to be the first point of contact for each customer, offering the highest quality in customer service. To have full knowledge of the Workouts and products (FG and 3rd parties) to maximise sales. Studio Hosts will also be key holders for the business and are responsible for opening and closing the Studio.

**Key duties and responsibilities:**  

Responsibilities for this role include, but are not limited to;

* Key holders for the business and responsible for Studio open and closing procedures
* Host daily briefings with the team in Studio Managers absence
* Accurate financial reporting on End of Day reports
* Inventory management, supporting with monitoring stock and conducting monthly stock takes
* Ownership of the customer journey, ensuring each customer’s visit is seamless
* Confidently communicate all contraindications to customers at point of booking
* Responsible for communicating the company cancellation and lateness policy to customers to keep a smooth running of business
* Ensuring that every client completes an intake form and that this is checked before every Workout
* Responsible for the rebooking of clients and the upselling of Workouts to maximise the business
* Responsible for meeting individual targets and KPI’s (key performance indicators)
* Maintain an exceptional customer experience at every touch point of the customer experience in the Studio
* Ensuring the front desk, and work stations are clean and presentable stocked with the necessary products and tools/equipment required to carry out the full range of workouts and necessary tasks
* Leading by example at all times ensuring that you portray a professional image and conduct yourself in a manner that represents the brand at a high standard
* To confidently manage and overcome customer complaints and challenges in the Studio and over the phone
* Accurately completing and checking all required paperwork and reports for the store and the team
* Being skilful on the Zenoti booking system to ensure revenue opportunities are not being missed, avoiding white space and unbookable slots
* Building and constantly updating knowledge on skincare, products and workouts.
* Communicate effectively and professionally with all the whole team throughout the day to support in the delivery of a 5-star customer experience and making the team aware of any challenges may arise
* Operating efficiently point of sale systems, card machines and tills

**SALES**

* Responsible for selling the brands’ unique offerings, Workouts, boosters and homecare products within the studio and when promoting the brand front of house
* To have a strong focus on maximising retail potential and customer retention
* Having the confidence to overcome selling challenges and ability to create retail theatre to attract and entice customers, incorporating the client journey and brand story whilst engaging with customers
* Constantly look for ways to maximise revenue through re-bookings, retails sales and add-ons. Including the promotion of courses and using initiative to find ways to encourage the client to make a purchase
* Regularly overview the appointment schedules, waiting list, cancellations, and no-shows to ensure revenue opportunities are not being missed

**Person Specification:**  

The ideal candidate will:

* Experience within beauty, retail and spa
* Enjoys exploring opportunities and using own initiative
* Exceptional customer service skills
* A team player with inspirational social skills
* Articulate and confident communicator
* Experience working with an online booking system
* Fully flexible across weekdays, weekends and evenings


**Our Brand Values**  

***Feeling***  

***Action***  

***Confidence***  

***Expertise***

**Over to the best part, the Perks!**

* Generous commission on retail
* Exclusive Discounts: Enjoy personal, friends, and family discounts on our services, bringing the benefits of FACEGYM to your loved ones.
* Product Perks: Get 50% off FACEGYM products to help you look and feel your best.
* Special Celebrations: Celebrate your birthday or any special day with a paid day off, just for you.
* Supportive Resources: Access our free and confidential employee assistance program for personal and professional well-being.

title: Roofer / Siding and Carpentry Repair Technician
description:
**Roof Plus** of **Point Pleasant, NJ** is currently hiring for a **full-time Roofer / Siding and Carpentry Repair Technician** to evaluate a roof in need of maintenance, recommend solutions to the homeowner, and perform roof repairs, as well as complete assigned preventative maintenance. This roofing position typically works between **8 am and 6 pm**, but end times can vary and earns a **competitive wage** based on experience, **plus a $2,000 sign-on bonus and the potential for commissions**. Some Saturday work is available but not required. We are roof repair industry leaders and believe that hard work can also be fun.


In addition to **top pay** and our **positive work culture**, we offer our Roofer / Siding and Carpentry Repair Technician the following benefits and perks:

* 100% employer-paid health insurance
* Matching 401(k) plan
* Paid vacation
* Paid holidays


We also offer **dental, life, and Aflac insurance**.


So, now that you've learned the who, what, where, and why, you may be wondering HOW? It's easy! Just fill out our initial **mobile-friendly online application** to become part of our roofing team. We hope to meet you soon!

**OUR IDEAL ROOFER / SIDING AND CARPENTRY REPAIR TECHNICIAN**

* Respectful - be kind and helpful when communicating with others
* Team Player - get along well with others and enjoy being part of a team
* Career-minded - desire to have more than just a job
* Detail-oriented - have a keen eye when conducting repairs
* Reliable - show up on time when scheduled and ready to work


If these ideal traits describe you, please continue reading!

**ABOUT ROOF PLUS**


Roof Plus is a veteran-owned company with the goal to make roof repair and replacement as easy as possible for our customers. We understand the overwhelming feelings that home repairs can bring, that's why our team takes the time to explain the best choices for homes and the families in them. If there's a need for roofing repairs, roof cleaning, siding repairs, gutter repairs, window installation, or even full roof replacement, we have it covered.


Our team is **honest, dependable, and different**. Always striving to be better than the customer expects, our team works together to make it happen. To reward our employees for their WOW service we do everything we can to support them including **regular training to advance skills**. And we prefer to **promote from within**. If you enjoy a **happy, friendly work culture** you'll fit right in with Roof Plus.

**ROOFER / SIDING AND CARPENTRY REPAIR TECHNICIAN REQUIREMENTS**

* Valid driver's license with a relatively clean record
* Minimum 2 years of experience in exterior construction
* Comfortable working with heights
* Ability to lift 90 pounds


Do you have a positive, can-do attitude? Are you looking for more than just a job? Do you present yourself professionally? Can you effectively supervise other crew members? Are you cooperative and great at teamwork? Do you take pride in a job well done when performing roof repairs? If yes, give us the chance to review your information.

**ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR ROOFING TEAM?**


If you are excited about this roofing opportunity, don't delay. Apply today!

title: Payments Analyst
description:
#### **Description**

##### **Who We Are?**


Bally's Corporation is a global casino-entertainment company with a growing omni-channel presence. It currently owns and manages 15 casinos across 10 states, a golf course in New York, a horse racetrack in Colorado, and has access to OSB licenses in 18 states. It also owns Bally's Interactive International, formerly Gamesys Group, a leading, global, online gaming operator, Bally Bet, a first-in-class sports betting platform, and Bally Casino, a growing iCasino platform.


With 10,600 employees, the Company's casino operations include approximately 15,300 slot machines, 580 table games and 3,800 hotel rooms. Upon completing the construction of a permanent casino facility in Chicago, IL, and a land-based casino near the Nittany Mall in State College, PA, Bally's will own and/or manage 16 casinos across 11 states. Bally’s also has rights to developable land in Las Vegas post the closure of the Tropicana. It shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "BALY".

##### **Well, What About The Team?**


The Payments Team remit covers all Interactive brands across the North America region. They are responsible for ensuring our patrons can deposit and withdrawal across our brands in a timely, secure, and seamless manner.The ideal payments analyst candidate has a passion for online payments, brings a high attention to detail, is customer focused and enjoys working in a fast paced and growing organisation.


Please note that this position has access to customers details – therefore requires employees to be able to obtain and maintain licensing in all jurisdictions Bally’s operates in. By applying for this role, and supplying the necessary details, you hereby grant us permission to apply for these background checks upon a successful job offer. This will be done in a confidential manner, and solely for the purposes of verification.

##### **So, What Will You Be Doing?**

* Monitoring payments to detect suspicious or unexpected activity, troubleshoot problems/issues as they may arise.
* Ensuring day to day contact with payments providers to resolve operational/customer queries
* Supporting with testing of new payment solutions
* Responding to and resolving customer’s payments related queries
* Ensuring chargeback analysis, Dispute Management and Reporting
* Looking to see how processes can be improved to both enhance customer experience and reduce risk
* Working with key stakeholders; Compliance, KYC, Fraud, Risk, AML, and Customer Support teams to ensure alignment of processes and clear communication
* Working flexible hours (including weekends if required) to support the business needs

##### **And What Are We Looking For?**

* Experience with MS Office Tools - MS Excel
* Experience with customer service & communication skills, both verbal and written
* Experience with online Sports Betting and Casino experience.
* Strong judgement to make rationale and balanced decisions with regards to player cases.
* Experience with cirtical thinking
* Experience working in fast paced and challenging enviornment
* Experience with online payments or banking
* Knowledge of online gaming payments and AML process
* Bachelors Degree preferred but commensurate experience is considered
* Demonstrate fluency in both English and Spanish (preferred)

##### **This Is What You'll Get**


Different benefits packages are tailored to fit each location, but here’s a taste of what may be on offer

* Annual vacation
* Annual bonus
* 401K program
* Health insurance
* Company share scheme
* Home office allowance

##### **Dna / Values**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are driven by a set of core values that we like to call our DNA. We strive to embody our DNA and keep them at the heart of everything we do!


We are


##### **Always Ready**


to embrace change, adapt, and do what it takes to delight our customers. We believe that
##### **You Make The Difference**


, which is what gives our players the best experience and keeps them coming back. We are
##### **All One Team**


, looking out for each other, respecting diversity while connecting through a common purpose. Our teams are
##### **Learning Every Day**


by showing constant curiosity and the drive to learn from successes, mistakes, new experiences, and the people around us. At Bally’s we
##### **Love To Lead**


by thinking differently, seeking innovation, and always looking for ways to raise our game.
##### **Equal Opportunities**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment and working conditions.


Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are important to us, and we encourage a culture where everyone can be themselves at work.


We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success, this is our superpower.


We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, age, sex or sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, political opinion or disability.

##### **Flexible Working**


At Bally’s Interactive, we believe in the power of collaboration and working together in a shared space, as well as the benefits of working from home. We champion hybrid working wherever we can, offering a flexible blend of working in the office 3 days a week and from home twice a week.

##### **Salary 55000 To 58000 Usd**


  
#### **Bally's Interactive - Jersey City**


#### **FIND YOUR CALLING ON THE BIG APPLE'S DOORSTEP...**


Our New Jersey office is situated right on the edge of the Hudson River with an unbeatable view of the New York City skyline, just a few blocks and a short ferry ride away from all the hustle and bustle of big city life. The weather gets a little brisk down by the water (so pack a good winter coat!), but there’s always something going on in this eclectic and lively city, voted the most culturally diverse US city in 2020.


Join our New Jersey team and you’ll find a fun bunch of people specialising in a wide range of areas across the business, including Payments, Fraud and Risk, Marketing, Chat, Social Media, and Customer Service. You will also find a burning passion for food, (honestly, there are so many great places to eat nearby), an unparalleled snack closet, and truly killer karaoke nights.

title: Graphic Designer (Casino)
description:
#### **Description**

##### **Who We Are**


Bally's Corporation is a global casino-entertainment company with a growing omni-channel presence. It currently owns and manages 15 casinos across 10 states, a golf course in New York, a horse racetrack in Colorado, and has access to OSB licenses in 18 states. Bally’s also has rights to developable land in Las Vegas post the closure of the Tropicana. It shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "BALY".

##### **Well, What About The Team?**


The purpose of the Design Team is to be the hub of excellence for creative concept development and design within the Bally’s Interactive North America Marketing organization. The design team provides an internal agency service that owns the development of end-to-end brand worlds, creative assets for our Ventures across both the US and Canada. A real focus on ensuring our people have the best processes and ways of working to allow an efficient workflow and collaboration, within the team and across all of Marketing.The assets span many channels including our websites, digital display, social and physical CRM and E-CRM. ##### **So, What Will You Be Doing?**

* Ensuring all material produced conforms with the brand’s visual guidelines
* Working equally well with clients and in-house teams

* Utilizing Adobe Creative Suite, Premiere Pro and After Effects

##### **And What Are We Looking For**

* Able to work to strict deadlines with unerring accuracy
* Demonstrate keen eye for detail and an obsession with typography, design and layout
* Show awareness of the current digital landscape

* Exhibit bravery to try new things, learn from failures and have fun along the way

##### **Experience Required**

* A portfolio which showcases an ability to produce visually inventive and effective work across a range of platforms, from website to app to social media
* Have understanding of sports and gaming world a bonus
* Have understanding of HTML/CSS and how digital platforms work

##### **This Is What You'll Get**

* Annual vacation
* Annual bonus
* 401K program
* Health insurance
* Company share scheme
* Home office allowance

##### **Dna / Values**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are driven by a set of core values that we like to call our DNA. We strive to embody our DNA and keep them at the heart of everything we do!


We are

##### **Always Ready**


to embrace change, adapt, and do what it takes to delight our customers. We believe that##### **You Make The Difference**


, which is what gives our players the best experience and keeps them coming back. We are##### **All One Team**


, looking out for each other, respecting diversity while connecting through a common purpose. Our teams are##### **Learning Every Day**


by showing constant curiosity and the drive to learn from successes, mistakes, new experiences, and the people around us. At Bally’s we##### **Love To Lead**


by thinking differently, seeking innovation, and always looking for ways to raise our game.
##### **Equal Opportunities**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment and working conditions. title: Customer Service Representative
description:
#### **Description**

##### **Who We Are?**


Bally's Corporation is a global casino-entertainment company with a growing omni-channel presence. It currently owns and manages 15 casinos across 10 states, a golf course in New York, a horse racetrack in Colorado, and has access to OSB licenses in 18 states. It also owns Bally's Interactive International, formerly Gamesys Group, a leading, global, online gaming operator, Bally Bet, a first-in-class sports betting platform, and Bally Casino, a growing iCasino platform.


With 10,600 employees, the Company's casino operations include approximately 15,300 slot machines, 580 table games and 3,800 hotel rooms. Upon completing the construction of a permanent casino facility in Chicago, IL, and a land-based casino near the Nittany Mall in State College, PA, Bally's will own and/or manage 16 casinos across 11 states. Bally’s also has rights to developable land in Las Vegas post the closure of the Tropicana. It shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "BALY".

##### **Well, What About The Team?**


We are looking for a professional Call Center Representative to provide our customers with the best possible service. This Representative will answer questions, handle complaints, troubleshoot problems about our products and services, and handle a high volume of inbound or outbound calls, chats, and emails. The ideal candidate will seek to provide a positive experience for every customer that fully resolves their inquiry. They will empathize, listen, and understand the real reason for the contact and take their time to ask all clarifying questions to get a full 360-degree view of the contact. A successful representative will be efficient, detail-oriented, polite, knowledgeable, and able to adapt quickly to an ever-changing industry.

*Please note that this position has access to customers details – therefore requires employees to be able to obtain and maintain licensing in all jurisdictions Bally’s operates in. By applying for this role, and supplying the necessary details, you hereby grant us permission to apply for these background checks upon a successful job offer. This will be done in a confidential manner, and solely for the purposes of verification.*

##### **So What Will You Be Doing?**

* Understanding and addressing their needs, complaints, or other issues with products or services.
* Responding efficiently and accurately to contacts, explaining all possible solutions courteously and professionally.
* Engaging in active listening with callers, confirming or clarifying information, and diffusing angry clients.
* Utilizing software, databases, scripts, and tools appropriately.
* Understand and strive to comply or exceed call center metrics while providing excellent customer service.
* Being a part of and actively participating in all training, coaching and any other learning opportunities to expand knowledge of the company, products, and position.
* Adhering to all company policies and procedures.

##### **And What Are We Looking For?**

* Have passion for creating amazing customer experiences
* Understand how to balance quality vs. quantity
* Have growth/learning mindset to help manage change
* Demonstrate excellent thinking and problem-solving skills
* Able to sit for extended periods.
* Able to work on a computer with repetitive hand and wrist movement.
* Have exceptional attention to details
* Demonstrate fluency in both English and Spanish (preferred)

##### **Experience Required**

* High School Diploma or equivalent.
* Exceptional Customer Service Skills.
	+ 1+ Years of Customer Service Experience (Contact Center or Retail)
* Troubleshooting technical skills a plus.
* Great communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Proficiency with computers, especially our CRM and tools.
* Proficiency with computer systems
	+ Including basic troubleshooting
	+ Multiple platforms/operating systems
* Knowledge of any of the following a plus:
	+ iCasino and Online Sports Betting

##### **This Is What You'll Get**


Different benefits packages are tailored to fit each location, but here’s a taste of what may be on offer

* Annual vacation
* Annual bonus
* 401(k) program
* Health insurance
* Company share scheme
* Home office allowance

##### **Dna / Values**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are driven by a set of core values that we like to call our DNA. We strive to embody our DNA and keep them at the heart of everything we do!


We are Always Ready to embrace change, adapt, and do what it takes to delight our customers. We believe that You Make the Difference, which is what gives our players the best experience and keeps them coming back. We are All One Team, looking out for each other, respecting diversity while connecting through a common purpose. Our teams are Learning Every Day by showing constant curiosity and the drive to learn from successes, mistakes, new experiences, and the people around us. At Bally’s we Love to Lead by thinking differently, seeking innovation, and always looking for ways to raise our game.

##### **Equal Opportunities**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment and working conditions.


Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are important to us, and we encourage a culture where everyone can be themselves at work.


We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success, this is our superpower.


We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, age, sex or sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, political opinion or disability.

##### **Flexible Working**


At Bally’s Interactive, we believe in the power of collaboration and working together in a shared space, as well as the benefits of working from home. We champion hybrid working wherever we can, offering a flexible blend of working in the office 3 days a week and from home twice a week.

##### **Salary $42,000 Usd**


  
#### **Bally's Interactive - Jersey City**


#### **FIND YOUR CALLING ON THE BIG APPLE'S DOORSTEP...**


Our New Jersey office is situated right on the edge of the Hudson River with an unbeatable view of the New York City skyline, just a few blocks and a short ferry ride away from all the hustle and bustle of big city life. The weather gets a little brisk down by the water (so pack a good winter coat!), but there’s always something going on in this eclectic and lively city, voted the most culturally diverse US city in 2020.


Join our New Jersey team and you’ll find a fun bunch of people specialising in a wide range of areas across the business, including Payments, Fraud and Risk, Marketing, Chat, Social Media, and Customer Service. You will also find a burning passion for food, (honestly, there are so many great places to eat nearby), an unparalleled snack closet, and truly killer karaoke nights.

title: IT Support
description:
**Company Description**


Unity. Loyalty. Advancement. Charity. It’s what drives United Legwear & Apparel Co. to be the best global designer, manufacturer, and distributor of legwear, bodywear, apparel, and accessories. Founded in 1998 by Isaac E. Ash to make the very best legwear on the market, ULAC is an industry leader offering a full range of products for babies, kids, teens, and adults. We strive to sell our products at affordable prices for families. Hard work and exponential growth year on year has transformed ULAC into a global apparel and accessories company.


Our goal to deliver superior products that ensure superior customer satisfaction is made possible by our team of dedicated professionals who work together to make the company the best in business. Our manufacturing, distribution, and logistics division produces the highest quality products at the best possible prices without cutting corners. Integrity of goods is key, so compliance and quality assurance are top priorities, along with meeting every delivery date—whether shipping across the state or around the world.


We strive to foster an inclusive company culture that stands united to accomplish our mission. We are loyal to our people, supporting their development and ability to achieve excellence. We believe that when people bring their personal best to work each day, it leads to success, advancement, and upward mobility for all. We believe every individual has two hands: one to help themself, and one to help others. We pride ourselves in our value of charity and the commitments we make to help people in need. ULAC supports organizations that help those compromised by sickness, poverty, natural disasters, socioeconomic inequality, and other dire circumstances.


If you share our vision of delivering superior products in a culture of growth, excellence, and caring, then we want to hear from you!


For more information about United Legwear & Apparel Co., please visit: https://www.unitedlegwear.com

**Job Summary:**  

The IT Support position is responsible for providing technical assistance for business operations. This position will install, upgrade and troubleshoot hardware and software systems. The IT Support position communicates effectively with both clients and technicians, translates technical needs into business solutions and possesses a broad IT knowledge. This position encompasses a problem-solving attitude along with the ability to give clear technical instructions and familiarity with remote troubleshooting techniques

**Essential Functions (Including but not limited to):**

* Address user support tickets regarding hardware, software and networking and meet SLA’s
* Guide users through installing applications and computer peripherals
* Ask targeted questions to diagnose problems
* Guide users with simple, step-by-step instructions
* Conduct remote troubleshooting
* Test alternative pathways until issue is resolved
* Customize desktop applications to meet user needs
* Record technical issues and solutions in logs
* Direct unresolved issues to the next level of support personnel
* Follow up with user to ensure systems are functional
* Report user feedback and potential product requests
* Aid in creating technical documentation and manuals
* Maintain and resolve issues on LAN/WAN
* Perform any other duties as assigned in support of the company needs and operations.

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* Proven work experience as a Desktop Support Engineer, Technical Support Engineer or similar role
* Hands-on experience with Windows/Linux/Mac OS environments
* Experience with computer and peripherals (printers and scanners) setup and troubleshooting
* Knowledge of network security practices and anti-virus programs
* Ability to perform remote troubleshooting and provide clear instructions
* Excellent problem-solving and multitasking skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills and a team-player attitude **Core Technical Skills:**
* Windows 8/10, Server 2012
* MS Office, O365, Exchange/Outlook,
* Experience with IT Ticket system and IT Management system, experience with AutoTask and/or Kaseya is a plus.
* Active Directory Admin capabilities: create/delete mailboxes, distribution lists, experience with GPO
* Networking gear: Routers, Switches, Firewalls
* Experience with Cisco and SonicWall are a plus
* Experience with spam filters, experience Mimecast is a plus

**Salary Range:**  

***$60,000-$80,000***

**Workplace Type:**  

*Full-time, onsite*

* ***United Legwear & Apparel Company is interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we do not currently sponsor visas. Also, please note that United Legwear & Apparel Company has partnered with USCIS and participates in their E-Verify program.***

title: Compliance and Quality Assurance Coordinator
description:
**Company Description**  

  

Unity. Loyalty. Advancement. Charity. It’s what drives United Legwear & Apparel Co. to be the best global designer, manufacturer, and distributor of legwear, bodywear, apparel, and accessories. Founded in 1998 by Isaac E. Ash to make the very best legwear on the market, ULAC is an industry leader offering a full range of products for babies, kids, teens, and adults. We strive to sell our products at affordable prices for families. Hard work and exponential growth year on year has transformed ULAC into a global apparel and accessories company.


Our goal to deliver superior products that ensure superior customer satisfaction is made possible by our team of dedicated professionals who work together to make the company the best in business. Our manufacturing, distribution, and logistics division produces the highest quality products at the best possible prices without cutting corners. Integrity of goods is key, so compliance and quality assurance are top priorities, along with meeting every delivery date—whether shipping across the state or around the world.


We strive to foster an inclusive company culture that stands united to accomplish our mission. We are loyal to our people, supporting their development and ability to achieve excellence. We believe that when people bring their personal best to work each day, it leads to success, advancement, and upward mobility for all. We believe every individual has two hands: one to help themself, and one to help others. We pride ourselves in our value of charity and the commitments we make to help people in need. ULAC supports organizations that help those compromised by sickness, poverty, natural disasters, socioeconomic inequality, and other dire circumstances.


If you share our vision of delivering superior products in a culture of growth, excellence, and caring, then we want to hear from you!


For more information about United Legwear & Apparel Co., please visit: https://www.unitedlegwear.com

**Compliance and QA Coordinator**


The Compliance and Quality Assurance Coordinator is responsible for coordinating daily communication between Factories/Suppliers and internal related departments to ensure factory compliance and customers/brands product quality expectations (Testing and inspection) are met.

**Essential Functions (Including but not limited to):**

* Evaluate products to ensure compliance with ULAC testing standards and customer testing requirements by examining physical product samples with cross functional teams.
* Provide support onboarding and setting up New Factories/ Suppliers.
* Ongoing assurance of Factories/Supplier’s adherence to different Brands/Retailers/Customers Social & Environmental compliance, Security Audit and Quality audit.
* Proactively work with Factories/Supplier on remediation plans to improve factory’s compliance rating.
* Communication daily with Factories/Suppliers to request required regulatory and performance testing for Softlines product.
* Evaluation of testing reports for Softlines product.
* Manage and resolve testing failures and non-compliance with Factories/Suppliers and Retailers.
* Ensure testing requirements for major retailers.
* Maintain documentation and update testing status on internal systems.
* Communicate potential issues to cross function teams.
* Issue General Conformity Certificate to suppliers upon receipt of all required passing test reports.
* Coordinate with 3rd party testing lab and audit firm to finalize testing protocols, reviewing testing charges and audit programs.
* Good understanding of Apparel sustainability initiatives, For example: Higg Index, GRS, RCS, GOTS, etc.
* Perform any other duties as requested by management in support of the company needs and operations

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* Associate or bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university preferred
* Minimum 2 years of work experience in some capacity associated with apparel production, product testing, and/or factory compliance.
* Knowledge of US federal and state safety regulations for apparel, including CPSC, CPSIA, and CA Prop65.
* Experience with testing programs and factory compliance of major retailers, including Walmart, Costco, Kohls, a plus.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office products, Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Must have the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines consistently.

**Salary Range:**  

This role is considered a contract position 3- 6 months.

**Workplace Type: On-site**

* ***United Legwear & Apparel Company is interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we do not currently sponsor visas.***

title: Experienced Installer - Gutter Installations
company: The Brothers That Just Do Gutters
description:
**The Brothers That Just Do Gutters** is currently hiring for a **full-time Experienced Installer** to perform new and replacement gutter installations in the **Poughkeepsie, NY** area. This installation technician position earns **$15.00 - $21.00 an hour**, based on skills and performance. Plus, we **pay weekly**. We are local industry leaders in this essential trade and believe that hard work can also be fun.


In addition to **great pay** and our **exceptional culture**, we offer the following benefits:

* Paid time off
* Sick time
* A 401(k) plan


We also offer **a skills ladder training program that clearly defines your career path, expectations, and raise potential**.


So, now that you've learned the who, what, where, and why, you may be wondering HOW? It's easy! Just fill out our initial **mobile-friendly online application**. We hope to meet you soon!

* Respectful - be kind, positive, and helpful
* Career-minded - looking for more than a job
* Self-motivated - sees what needs to be done and does it
* Team player - get along well with others and have a true understanding of teamwork

If these ideal installation technician traits describe you, please continue reading!

We are a full-service rain gutter and gutter guard franchise. We repair, install and maintain everything from Seamless Gutter Guards to Specialty Gutters, and it doesn't stop there. No matter the job, our customers know they can count on The Brothers for quality craftsmanship and customer service.


We are big on personal and career growth, loyalty, and caring. We want our team to achieve their goals and aspirations. Through our provided training, defined career paths, and promotions from within, it is easy to succeed. Our great culture is also supported through **company events** that encourage employee interaction and interpersonal relationships. Don't settle for a fixer-upper career, join us!

* Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions/seasons
* Able to work overtime
* Previous experience in gutter services/installation
* Comfortable with heights
* Must be 18 or older
* Must have a valid driver's license


If you are excited about this installation technician opportunity, don't delay. **Apply today**!

No matter the job, our customers know they can count on The Brothers for quality craftsmanship and customer service.


We are big on personal and career growth, loyalty, and caring. We want our team to achieve their goals and aspirations. We fully invest in our team and strive to curate a comfortable work environment. We provide positive, professional, and respectful communication with every fellow employee. Through our provided training, defined career paths, and promotions from within, it is easy to succeed. Our great culture is also supported through **company events** that encourage employee interaction and interpersonal relationships. Don't settle for a fixer-upper career, join us!

 **A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN ENTRY-LEVEL GUTTER INSTALLER**


As an Entry-Level Gutter Installer, you ask questions, observe, and emulate the values we adhere to here at The Brothers. You go out in the field with experienced installers. While being their helper, they mentor and train you on everything from how to properly install gutters to how to professionally interact with our clients.


You are a hard worker who does whatever is asked of you and pays close attention to what you're being taught. You enjoy interacting with clients and fellow employees. You enjoy expanding your knowledge and skills. You are excited to be part of our team and can't wait to advance in this stable and essential industry!

 **QUALIFICATIONS**

* Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions/seasons
* Ability to work overtime
* Comfortable with heights

**2 years of experience in construction is a plus, but not required, we will train the right person!** Are you an honest, hard-working individual? Do you have effective communication skills? Are you punctual and reliable? Do you pay attention to detail? Are you a self-starter who is willing to ask questions? Are you a team player who is interested in a long-term career in installation? If so, you might just be perfect for this Entry-Level Gutter Installer position. Apply now using our initial **3-minute, mobile-friendly application!**
