title: Auto Repair Technician
description:
**Croce's Transmission Specialists** is currently hiring for a **full-time Auto Repair Technician** to perform auto repairs, maintenance, and diagnostics in the **Norwalk, CT** area. This automotive position earns a **competitive salary** of **$52,000+ per year**, based on skill level and performance.


In addition to **competitive pay** and our **award-winning culture**, we offer our Mechanics the following benefits:

* Health insurance
* Supplemental Aflac
* Paid time off (PTO)
* Paid holidays
* Simple IRA
* Uniforms
* Ongoing training
* Promotion opportunities


So, now that you've learned the who, what, where, and why, you may be wondering HOW to apply for this automotive mechanic opportunity? It's easy! Just fill out our initial **mobile-friendly online application**. We hope to meet you soon!

 **DAY-TO-DAY**


This full-time automotive mechanic position typically works **Monday - Friday, from 8 am - 4:30 pm**. **No weekends**!


As an automotive mechanic, you are extremely important to our success as you ensure properly functioning vehicles and equipment. On a day-to-day basis, you conduct routine maintenance, diagnose problems with inspection software, perform repairs, and work on transmissions. Additionally, you disassemble and reassemble parts as well as keep logs of all the work that's performed. You also examine vehicles to determine if additional safety work is needed and notify the service advisor. As a diligent worker, you follow checklists and the proper safety procedures. **You enjoy working on new things each day and making our customers feel safe and happy in their ride**!

 **ABOUT CROCE'S TRANSMISSION SPECIALISTS**


In 1999, Maryann and Tony Croce established Croce's Transmission Specialists, a high-tech, full-service automotive repair facility. Mary's background in banking, management, and customer service perfectly complements Tony's years of technical training and repair experience. For more than 20 years, we've been "taking the fear out of auto repair," dependably providing services ranging from transmission replacement to brake repair. Customers rely on our commitment to integrity, transparency, and caring. **Our focus is not simply on what we do, but on how we do it**.


We know we wouldn't be successful without the efforts of our amazing crew. As a family-run repair shop, we want our employees to feel like an important part of our Croce's Transmission family. We value and appreciate our staff and treat team members with respect. To show our gratitude, we offer **great job perks** and **promote from within the company**. We hope you'll join us!

 **OUR IDEAL AUTO REPAIR TECHNICIAN**

* Effective communicator - ability to clearly express mechanical information clearly and in layman's terms
* Detail-oriented - extremely attentive to detail and passionate about getting the job done right
* Friendly - easily establishes a good rapport with people


If this sounds like you, keep reading about this opportunity to gain valuable experience as an automotive mechanic!

 **REQUIREMENTS FOR AN AUTO REPAIR TECHNICIAN**

* 2-3 years of verifiable Automotive Tech experience
* Clean driver's license
* Ability to lift and carry objects weighing 75 pounds
* Ability to work in different weather conditions including heat, cold, rain, and snow
* Basic computer skills
* Need to have your own tools


Automotive Service Excellence (ASE) certification, experience as an auto technician, and knowledge about transmissions are a plus, but not required. **We are willing to train the right person**! If you meet the above requirements, we need you. Apply today to join our team as an Experienced Auto Repair Technician!

title: Graphic Designer (Sports)
description:
#### **Description**

##### **Who We Are**


Bally's Corporation is a global casino-entertainment company with a growing omni-channel presence. It currently owns and manages 15 casinos across 10 states, a golf course in New York, a horse racetrack in Colorado, and has access to OSB licenses in 18 states. It also owns Bally's Interactive International, formerly Gamesys Group, a leading, global, online gaming operator, Bally Bet, a first-in-class sports betting platform, and Bally Casino, a growing iCasino platform.


With 10,600 employees, the Company's casino operations include approximately 15,300 slot machines, 580 table games and 3,800 hotel rooms. Upon completing the construction of a permanent casino facility in Chicago, IL, and a land-based casino near the Nittany Mall in State College, PA, Bally's will own and/or manage 16 casinos across 11 states. Bally’s also has rights to developable land in Las Vegas post the closure of the Tropicana. It shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "BALY".

##### **Well, What About The Team?**


The purpose of the Design Team is to be the hub of excellence for creative concept development and design within the Bally’s Interactive North America Marketing organization. The design team provides an internal agency service that owns the development of end-to-end brand worlds, creative assets for our Ventures across both the US and Canada. A real focus on ensuring our people have the best processes and ways of working to allow an efficient workflow and collaboration, within the team and across all of Marketing.The assets span many channels including our websites, digital display, social and physical CRM and E-CRM. Essentially, every step of a customer journey.


As a Designer at Bally’s Interactive you will be responsible for creating designs for both the Casino and Sportsbook product lines. These will appear on both digital and print platforms, from app store images and acquisition email headers to OOH billboard to in Casino signage.

##### **So, What Will You Be Doing?**

* Turning briefs into original and distinctive designs and content
* Working with both the requestor and Design Managers to ensure their vision is realized and enhanced
* Ensuring all material produced conforms with the brand’s visual guidelines
* Working equally well with clients and in-house teams
* Working within the confines of technical elements of digital and print design depending on the platform, be this responsive design, differences between various social media channels, or various print specifications
* Utilizing Adobe Creative Suite, Premiere Pro and After Effects

##### **And What Are We Looking For**

* Have ability to create content which resonates with the desired target audience through innovative and memorable design
* Able to work to strict deadlines with unerring accuracy
* Demonstrate keen eye for detail and an obsession with typography, design and layout
* Show awareness of the current digital landscape
* Display ambition and drive to work in a fast-paced, results-focused environment
* Exhibit bravery to try new things, learn from failures and have fun along the way

##### **Experience Required**

* 3+ years of experience working in a designer role for a brand or agency
* A portfolio which showcases an ability to produce visually inventive and effective work across a range of platforms, from website to app to social media
* Have understanding of sports and gaming world a bonus
* Have understanding of HTML/CSS and how digital platforms work

##### **This Is What You'll Get**


Different benefits packages are tailored to fit each location, but here’s a taste of what may be on offer

* Annual vacation
* Annual bonus
* 401K program
* Health insurance
* Company share scheme
* Home office allowance

##### **Dna / Values**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are driven by a set of core values that we like to call our DNA. We strive to embody our DNA and keep them at the heart of everything we do!


We are

##### **Always Ready**


to embrace change, adapt, and do what it takes to delight our customers. We believe that##### **You Make The Difference**


, which is what gives our players the best experience and keeps them coming back. We are##### **All One Team**


, looking out for each other, respecting diversity while connecting through a common purpose. Our teams are##### **Learning Every Day**


by showing constant curiosity and the drive to learn from successes, mistakes, new experiences, and the people around us. At Bally’s we##### **Love To Lead**


by thinking differently, seeking innovation, and always looking for ways to raise our game.
##### **Equal Opportunities**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment and working conditions. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are important to us, and we encourage a culture where everyone can be themselves at work. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success, this is our superpower.


We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, age, sex or sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, political opinion or disability.

**Flexible Working**At Bally’s Interactive, we believe in the power of collaboration and working together in a shared space, as well as the benefits of working from home. We champion hybrid working wherever we can, offering a flexible blend of working in the office 3 days a week and from home twice a week.

##### **Salary Range $65,000 $85,000 Usd**

##### **#Li Op1**


  
#### **Bally's Interactive - Jersey City**


#### **FIND YOUR CALLING ON THE BIG APPLE'S DOORSTEP...**


Our New Jersey office is situated right on the edge of the Hudson River with an unbeatable view of the New York City skyline, just a few blocks and a short ferry ride away from all the hustle and bustle of big city life. The weather gets a little brisk down by the water (so pack a good winter coat!), but there’s always something going on in this eclectic and lively city, voted the most culturally diverse US city in 2020.


Join our New Jersey team and you’ll find a fun bunch of people specialising in a wide range of areas across the business, including Payments, Fraud and Risk, Marketing, Chat, Social Media, and Customer Service. You will also find a burning passion for food, (honestly, there are so many great places to eat nearby), an unparalleled snack closet, and truly killer karaoke nights.

title: Customer Service Manager
description:
#### **Description**

##### **Who We Are**


Bally's Corporation is a global casino-entertainment company with a growing omni-channel presence. It currently owns and manages 15 casinos across 10 states, a golf course in New York, a horse racetrack in Colorado, and has access to OSB licenses in 18 states. It also owns Bally's Interactive International, formerly Gamesys Group, a leading, global, online gaming operator, Bally Bet, a first-in-class sports betting platform, and Bally Casino, a growing iCasino platform.


With 10,600 employees, the Company's casino operations include approximately 15,300 slot machines, 580 table games and 3,800 hotel rooms. Upon completing the construction of a permanent casino facility in Chicago, IL, and a land-based casino near the Nittany Mall in State College, PA, Bally's will own and/or manage 16 casinos across 11 states. Bally’s also has rights to developable land in Las Vegas post the closure of the Tropicana. It shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "BALY".

##### **Well, What About The Team?**


The Customer Service team is focused on creating a fun and hassle-free experience for all players needing our support. We are often the first point of contact for patrons who need help or have had a problem. Listening with a high focus on detail and then offering efficient solutions is critical to the overall success of our goal of delivering best-in-class player experience. The manager position is a crucial leadership point to support the overall contact center's efforts.


The Customer Service Manager is responsible for all aspects of the day-to-day operations of the Customer Service department, from Customer Service Representatives up to Customer Service Team Leads. Reporting into Vice President of Operations, the Customer Service Manager works to ensure that the Customer Service department operates at peak efficiency and in-line with corporate objectives and service quality.


As our sites operate 24/7 so does our Customer Service department. Therefore, this non-exempt role demands flexibility and will be based on the needs of the business.

*Please note that this position has access to customers details – therefore requires employees to be able to obtain and maintain licensing in all jurisdictions Bally’s operates in. By applying for this role, and supplying the necessary details, you hereby grant us permission to apply for these background checks upon a successful job offer. This will be done in a confidential manner, and solely for the purposes of verification.*

##### **So, What Will You Be Doing?**

* Hiring, developing, leading and motivating the Customer Service team to ensure they are giving best-in-class customer experiences while exceeding our KPI goals and standards.
* Supported by the Vice President of Operations, responsible for reviewing and updating resourcing models to ensure the team is efficiently staffed to meet SLAs.
* Performance reporting, including:
	+ Daily reviewing of previous days' performance and action items to implement immediate improvements for missed opportunities.
	+ Publishing of weekly/monthly management reports summarizing performance across the team including any relevant matters/insights.
	+ Cascading regular feedback to the team on performance / initiatives and relevant updates.
	+ Department KPIs to track performance and implement strategies and/or optimise procedures to meet and improve targets.
* Effectively managing and developing Customer Service Team Leads to drive the performance of Customer Service Representatives and Shift Supervisors.
* Alerting the Vice President of Operations to any department infractions that may result in termination of employment.
* Serving as a final point of escalation for patrons who wish to escalate concerns, questions or complaints above the supervisory/team leader levels.
* Acting as a point of contact to resolve any internet gaming complaints directed to a venture’s Internet Gaming Manager, a jurisdiction’s regulatory agency, or the Better Business Bureau.
* Working closely with key business functions including:
	+ Product workstreams as a stakeholder in customer support.
	+ Training/QA to identify and share training needs.
	+ Operational Excellence to support the implementation of initiatives.
	+ Gaming Finance to share learning to reduce escalations and drive an improved customer experience.
	+ Compliance to ensure that staff are familiar with and compliant with the latest customer-facing regulations.
* Implementing change initiatives and actively promoting a positive culture focused on performance, accountability, customer retention and results within the department.
* Developing and implementing customer service procedures and guidelines to ensure adherence to company policies and standards.
* Identifying areas for improvement and recommending changes to enhance service quality.

##### **And What Are We Looking For?**

* Demonstrate self-motivation with excellent time-management skills and a focus on accountability.
* Lead people effectively, fostering both a positive culture and high levels of performance.
* Possess an analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
* Manage competing priorities and self-organize.
* Enjoy working in a dynamic and stimulating environment.
* Exhibit a robust team player mindset, open to close collaboration with other teams
* Demonstrate exceptional critical thinking, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
* Exhibit excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Display a collaborative attitude and dedicated work ethic.
* Maintain a consistent mindset of continuous improvement and change.
* Demonstrate proficiency with computers.
* Required to report to the Jersey City office a minimum of 3 days per week.

##### **Experience Required**

* 5+ years’ experience of managing Customer Service teams of 25+ people.
* 2+ years’ experience in sports betting or iGaming industry
##### **Strongly Preferred**


.
* Advanced knowledge of Zendesk customer contact solution or similar tooling.
* Bachelor’s Degree preferred but commensurate experience will be considered.

##### **This Is What You'll Get**


Different benefits packages are tailored to fit each location, but here’s a taste of what may be on offer

* Annual leave
* Annual bonus
* 401K Program
* Health insurance
* Company share scheme
* Home office allowance

##### **Dna / Values**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are driven by a set of core values that we like to call our DNA. We strive to embody our DNA and keep them at the heart of everything we do!

to embrace change, adapt, and do what it takes to delight our customers. We believe that

by showing constant curiosity and the drive to learn from successes, mistakes, new experiences, and the people around us. At Bally’s we
##### **Love To Lead**


by thinking differently, seeking innovation, and always looking for ways to raise our game.
##### **Equal Opportunities**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment and working conditions.


Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are important to us, and we encourage a culture where everyone can be themselves at work.


We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success, this is our superpower.


We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, age, sex or sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, political opinion or disability.

##### **Flexible Working**


At Bally’s Interactive, we believe in the power of collaboration and working together in a shared space, as well as the benefits of working from home. We champion hybrid working wherever we can, offering a flexible blend of working in the office 3 days a week and from home twice a week.

title: Technical Designer [Hurley Men's]
description:
**Company Description**  

  

Unity. Loyalty. Advancement. Charity. It’s what drives United Legwear & Apparel Co. to be the best global designer, manufacturer, and distributor of legwear, bodywear, apparel, and accessories. Founded in 1998 by Isaac E. Ash to make the very best legwear on the market, ULAC is an industry leader offering a full range of products for babies, kids, teens, and adults. We strive to sell our products at affordable prices for families. Hard work and exponential growth year on year has transformed ULAC into a global apparel and accessories company.


Our goal to deliver superior products that ensure superior customer satisfaction is made possible by our team of dedicated professionals who work together to make the company the best in business. Our manufacturing, distribution, and logistics division produces the highest quality products at the best possible prices without cutting corners. Integrity of goods is key, so compliance and quality assurance are top priorities, along with meeting every delivery date—whether shipping across the state or around the world.


We strive to foster an inclusive company culture that stands united to accomplish our mission. We are loyal to our people, supporting their development and ability to achieve excellence. We believe that when people bring their personal best to work each day, it leads to success, advancement, and upward mobility for all. We believe every individual has two hands: one to help themself, and one to help others. We pride ourselves in our value of charity and the commitments we make to help people in need. ULAC supports organizations that help those compromised by sickness, poverty, natural disasters, socioeconomic inequality, and other dire circumstances.


If you share our vision of delivering superior products in a culture of growth, excellence, and caring, then we want to hear from you!


For more information about United Legwear & Apparel Co., please visit: https://www.unitedlegwear.com


We are seeking a detail-oriented and innovative Technical Designer for Men's Apparel to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in garment construction, pattern making, and fit analysis, combined with a passion for men's fashion. This role requires a meticulous eye for detail, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to ensure our men's apparel lines meet the highest standards of quality, fit, and design.  

  

**Essential Functions:*** Create technical specification packages that include detailed garment construction information, such as sewing details, trims, and measurements
* Measure incoming garments against vendor measurements and maintain accurate measurements and specifications to ensure consistency across all product categories
* Prepare and track samples for fittings and make sure approval dates are met
* Attend & run technical fittings by preparing samples, taking notes, and completing fit lists
* Maintain tech log under the direction of the design team
* Maintain tech packs under the direction of the Director of Design
* Generate detailed POM sketches, specs, and tech packs.
* Communication with factories in various methods, i.e. pattern correction, digital photos, technical sketches, technical notes, and garment construction
* Manage style input in web-based PLM
* Collaborate with internal/external teams: daily communication with overseas partners and internal Design, Production & Product Development department.
* Performs any other duties as assigned in support of the company's needs and operations.

**Qualifications Requirements**:* College degree in technical design, fashion design, or equivalent experience in a related area and a minimum of 3-5 years of technical design experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Technical design experience in Men's apparel, experience using PLM, and knowledge of 3D CAD are all preferred qualifications.
* High creativity and artistic abilities, an eye for color, texture, and pattern with keen attention to detail, and the ability to visualize in three dimensions.
* Knowledge of grade rule and sewing and of patternmaking and draping.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
* Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Office, Photoshop, Adobe Creative Suite, email, and the Internet.
* Excellent written and verbal skills as required for effective interpersonal communication and collaboration with design, sales team, and production
* Excellent organizational skills that reflect the ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks and workload seamlessly and follow up.


This is an onsite position in our NY Office. The salary range for this position is $75,000 - $85,000.

title: Retail Planner
description:
**Company Description:**  

  

Unity. Loyalty. Advancement. Charity. It’s what drives United Legwear & Apparel Co. to be the best global designer, manufacturer, and distributor of legwear, bodywear, apparel, and accessories. Founded in 1998 by Isaac E. Ash to make the very best legwear on the market, ULAC is an industry leader offering a full range of products for babies, kids, teens, and adults. We strive to sell our products at affordable prices for families. Hard work and exponential growth year on year has transformed ULAC into a global apparel and accessories company.


Our goal to deliver superior products that ensure superior customer satisfaction is made possible by our team of dedicated professionals who work together to make the company the best in business. Our manufacturing, distribution, and logistics division produces the highest quality products at the best possible prices without cutting corners. Integrity of goods is key, so compliance and quality assurance are top priorities, along with meeting every delivery date—whether shipping across the state or around the world.


We strive to foster an inclusive company culture that stands united to accomplish our mission. We are loyal to our people, supporting their development and ability to achieve excellence. We believe that when people bring their personal best to work each day, it leads to success, advancement, and upward mobility for all. We believe every individual has two hands: one to help themself, and one to help others. We pride ourselves in our value of charity and the commitments we make to help people in need. ULAC supports organizations that help those compromised by sickness, poverty, natural disasters, socioeconomic inequality, and other dire circumstances.


If you share our vision of delivering superior products in a culture of growth, excellence, and caring, then we want to hear from you!


For more information about United Legwear & Apparel Co., please visit: https://www.unitedlegwear.com  

  

***Job Summary***  

Work in partnership with Sales to maximize business/revenue on planned accounts businesses. The candidate should be forward-facing and represent the business in account meetings. The role will manage pre-season and in-season planning, including management of retailer open-to-buy driving sales, margin, turn and profitability.

**Essential Functions (Including but not limited to):*** Manage accounts OTBs to maximize profit, identify opportunities, and assess risk to the business.
* Collaborate with retailer account planners to align on the forecast.
	+ Reforecast during selling season to make sure all financial plans will be met.
	+ Ensure sufficient receipts are booked to cover sales orders and in season opportunities.
* Review OTBs for all retailers with Sales Team for transparency and partnership
* Adhoc Analysis
* Join sales teams on business review calls and communicate identified wins and challenges to key team members.
* Provide weekly/monthly/quarterly/seasonal selling analysis. Provide strategic guidance, key insights on trends, and recommendations to leadership in conjunction with the Sales team.
* Review core and fashion forecasts/buys to ensure receipts are within plan or forecast; communicate any potential stock risks and opportunities.
* Build business plans for new strategic growth initiatives, proposed 6-month flows, and ladder plans
* Create and manage bridge plans for go-to-market to ensure a grow/maintain/decline proposal is built to protect LY volume as well as forecasted incremental growth.
* Maintain and analyze monthly door reports; identify regional and sales-to-stock opportunities to account.
* Liaising with other areas of the business to help provide transparency on the current/future state of business.

**Qualifications/Requirements:*** 3-5 years’ experience in Retail or Merchandise Planning, or a related role within the apparel industry.
* Advanced computer skills in Excel required (v-lookups, pivot tables, complex formulas) and understanding of retail math.
* Excellent organization, negotiation, and communication skills and the ability to build relationships with customers and internal departments.
* Ability to operate and succeed in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment while maintaining a poise and a positive attitude.
* Knowledgeable with a variety of retail concepts, practices, and procedures.
* Must possess the ability to be a strong team player.


This is an on-site position. .  

The salary range for this role is $85,000 - $105,000.

title: Risk & Fraud Analyst
description:
#### **Description**

##### **Who We Are**


Bally's Corporation is a global casino-entertainment company with a growing omni-channel presence. It currently owns and manages 15 casinos across 10 states, a golf course in New York, a horse racetrack in Colorado, and has access to OSB licenses in 18 states. It also owns Bally's Interactive International, formerly Gamesys Group, a leading, global, online gaming operator, Bally Bet, a first-in-class sports betting platform, and Bally Casino, a growing iCasino platform.


With 10,600 employees, the Company's casino operations include approximately 15,300 slot machines, 580 table games and 3,800 hotel rooms. Upon completing the construction of a permanent casino facility in Chicago, IL, and a land-based casino near the Nittany Mall in State College, PA, Bally's will own and/or manage 16 casinos across 11 states. Bally’s also has rights to developable land in Las Vegas post the closure of the Tropicana. It shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "BALY".

##### **Well, What About The Team?**


Our team is growing and we're looking for a Risk & Fraud Analyst to be play an integral part in continuing to strengthen our team. Our Risk & Fraud team are responsible for detecting, identifying and preventing fraud losses to the business. Our team operates like many others: we verify legitimacy of accounts and play, validate, and review fraudulent activity and assist players and team members with various queries. Our team operates primarily on Eastern time and shifts range between Mon-Fri 07:00-18:00 with every 1 in 5 weekends required.

*Please note that this position has access to customers details – therefore requires employees to be able to obtain and maintain licensing in all jurisdictions Bally’s operates in. By applying for this role, and supplying the necessary details, you hereby grant us permission to apply for these background checks upon a successful job offer. This will be done in a confidential manner, and solely for the purposes of verification.*

##### **So, What Will You Be Doing?**

* Maintaining and providing outstanding customer service levels with any risk and fraud related items.
* Reviewing alerts detect and prevent fraudulent behavior on accounts.
* Performing account due diligences using appropriate tools in our back offices.
* Reviewing and responding to escalations from Payments, KYC, Customer Support, Compliance and VIP teams.
* Monitoring and reviewing daily reports to identify and mitigate fraud or suspicious activity using various tools.
* Analyzing and reviewing the deposit, withdrawal, gaming and other activity on player’s gaming accounts and request appropriate verification documentation.
* Tracking and recording any account that needs to be reported to the State Authorities and Regulating bodies.
* Identifying fraud patterns and ensure that corresponding leadership team is made aware of including Supervisors, Team Leads and Manager.
* Creating Suspicious Activity Reports (SAR) case narratives and appropriate supporting documentation that gets reviewed by Management.
* Reviewing and preparing weekly Compliance Reports that are presented on weekly committee calls.
* Reporting incidents, bugs, and malfunctions within day to day internal and external processes to Supervisors, Team leads and/or Manager.

##### **And What Are We Looking For?**

* Possess experience in online gambling or the banking industry.
* Have experience with Geocomply, LexisNexis and Sharepoint andIntermediate Excel/MS Office skills.
* Knowledge of risk management, internet industry and online payments mechanisms.
* Possess ability to work effectively and manage large contact volumes.
* Have meticulous attention to detail and ability to learn quickly from mistakes.
* Be a self motivator with ability to meet tight deadlines.
* Be inquisitive and want to investigate individuals/situations.
* Have exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
* Have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Demonstrate experience within industry Risk/Payments/Fraud teams and documents review/verification knowledge is preferred.

##### **This Is What You'll Get**


Different benefits packages are tailored to fit each location, but here’s a taste of what may be on offer

* Annual vacation
* Annual bonus
* 401K program
* Health insurance
* Company share scheme
* Home office allowance

##### **Dna / Values**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are driven by a set of core values that we like to call our DNA. We strive to embody our DNA and keep them at the heart of everything we do!


We are

##### **Always Ready**


to embrace change, adapt, and do what it takes to delight our customers. We believe that##### **You Make The Difference**


, which is what gives our players the best experience and keeps them coming back. We are##### **All One Team**


, looking out for each other, respecting diversity while connecting through a common purpose. Our teams are##### **Learning Every Day**


by showing constant curiosity and the drive to learn from successes, mistakes, new experiences, and the people around us. At Bally’s we##### **Love To Lead**


by thinking differently, seeking innovation, and always looking for ways to raise our game.
##### **Equal Opportunities**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment and working conditions. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are important to us, and we encourage a culture where everyone can be themselves at work. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success, this is our superpower.


We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, age, sex or sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, political opinion or disability.

##### **Salary Range $54,000 $60,000 Usd**


  
#### **Bally's Interactive - Jersey City**


#### **FIND YOUR CALLING ON THE BIG APPLE'S DOORSTEP...**


Our New Jersey office is situated right on the edge of the Hudson River with an unbeatable view of the New York City skyline, just a few blocks and a short ferry ride away from all the hustle and bustle of big city life. The weather gets a little brisk down by the water (so pack a good winter coat!), but there’s always something going on in this eclectic and lively city, voted the most culturally diverse US city in 2020.


Join our New Jersey team and you’ll find a fun bunch of people specialising in a wide range of areas across the business, including Payments, Fraud and Risk, Marketing, Chat, Social Media, and Customer Service. You will also find a burning passion for food, (honestly, there are so many great places to eat nearby), an unparalleled snack closet, and truly killer karaoke nights.

title: Assistant Product Developer
description:
**Company Description**


Unity. Loyalty. Advancement. Charity. It’s what drives United Legwear & Apparel Co. to be the best global designer, manufacturer, and distributor of legwear, bodywear, apparel, and accessories. Founded in 1998 by Isaac E. Ash to make the very best legwear on the market, ULAC is an industry leader offering a full range of products for babies, kids, teens, and adults. We strive to sell our products at affordable prices for families. Hard work and exponential growth year on year has transformed ULAC into a global apparel and accessories company.


Our goal to deliver superior products that ensure superior customer satisfaction is made possible by our team of dedicated professionals who work together to make the company the best in business. Our manufacturing, distribution, and logistics division produces the highest quality products at the best possible prices without cutting corners. Integrity of goods is key, so compliance and quality assurance are top priorities, along with meeting every delivery date—whether shipping across the state or around the world.


We strive to foster an inclusive company culture that stands united to accomplish our mission. We are loyal to our people, supporting their development and ability to achieve excellence. We believe that when people bring their personal best to work each day, it leads to success, advancement, and upward mobility for all. We believe every individual has two hands: one to help themself, and one to help others. We pride ourselves in our value of charity and the commitments we make to help people in need. ULAC supports organizations that help those compromised by sickness, poverty, natural disasters, socioeconomic inequality, and other dire circumstances.


If you share our vision of delivering superior products in a culture of growth, excellence, and caring, then we want to hear from you!


For more information about United Legwear & Apparel Co., please visit: https://www.unitedlegwear.com

  

The product development assistant is an entry-level job position, with the potential to grow within the department. They will work closely with the Product Development (PD) team to develop and improve existing products. They will help us with order placement follow-up processes, collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that all products meet design and quality standards, coordinate with the production teams and product suppliers to ensure that product development schedules are adhered to, and all products are delivered on time.  

  

The product development assistant should also be able to work independently and perform all other tasks delegated by their manager, including but not limited to providing general administrative and clerical support to PD team including filing, mailing, scanning, faxing, copying, maintaining seasonal WIP reports, and assisting with ad-hoc projects. Work with the PD & Production team to facilitate and follow up with the status of orders in the factories, and track and maintain department samples/submissions. Prepares samples and other requests for shipment.  

  

***Job Overview***  

The product development assistant is an entry-level job position, with the potential to grow within the department. They will work closely with the Product Development (PD) team to develop and improve existing products. They will help us with order placement follow-up processes, collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that all products meet design and quality standards, coordinate with the production teams and product suppliers to ensure that product development schedules are adhered to, and all products are delivered on time. The product development assistant should also be able to work independently and perform all other tasks delegated by their manager, including but not limited to providing general administrative and clerical support to PD team including filing, mailing, scanning, faxing, copying, maintaining seasonal WIP reports, and assisting with ad-hoc projects. Work with PD & Production team to facilitate and follow up with the status of orders in the factories, and track and maintain department samples/submissions. Prepares samples and other requests for shipment.  

  

**Qualifications/Requirements:*** Communicates daily with overseas vendors on delegated product development matters.
* Strict attention to detail and ability to prioritize tasks.
* Proven ability to organize large amounts of information using MS Office (SharePoint, Excel, etc.) and Monday.com task management platform (will be taught if needed).
* Proactive attitude, team player.
* Responsible for learning how to assist with approvals on fabric, print, color, trim, and pre-production samples.
* Develops best practices to optimize product development procedures.
* Aids design, merchandising, and development teams (show room set up, sample preparations, shipping label requests/sending packages out to suppliers, etc).
* Maintains consistency and accuracy of information flow between development, production, and overseas vendors.
* Provides project status updates to management on request.
* Organize and maintain materials for development teams (standard binders, color & fabric libraries, file cabinets, shipping forms, etc).
* Perform any other duties as assigned in support of the company's needs and operations.

**Experience/Skills:*** Bachelor’s degree in fashion or related area and 2 years of experience in apparel product development.
* Knowledge of color and color correction and ability to score 16 or above on the Farnsworth Munsell 100 Hue test.
* Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Office and Adobe, database systems, email, and the internet.
* Excellent written and verbal skills as required for effective interpersonal communication with clients and other employees.
* Strong organizational skills that reflect the ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks and workloads seamlessly with keen attention to detail and follow-up.
* Experience working in a fast-paced environment and ability to apply good work habits to effectively complete assigned tasks and contribute to the smooth operation of the company.
* Experience working with external 3rd party manufacturing partners is a plus.

**This is an onsite position.**  

  

**The salary range for this position is $60,000 - $70,000.**  

  

* ***United Legwear & Apparel Company is interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we do not currently sponsor visas. Also, please note that United Legwear & Apparel Company has partnered with USCIS and participates in their E-Verify program.***

title: Assistant General Manager - Shake Shack
description:
**Assistant General Manager**


**What We Do**


At Applegreen, we ***Refresh Travelers on their Journey****….* ApplegreenUSA operates over 80 travel plazas across the Northeast and Midwest that provide convenience, comfort, retail, and an extensive range of delicious food options such as Auntie Anne’s, Burger King, Chick-fil-A, Cinnabon, Dunkin Donuts, Panda Express, Panera, Popeyes, Pret, Shake Shack, Starbucks, and many more.


**Our Core Values**


Our Core Values are what we stand for. They guide and motivate our attitudes and behaviors to our customers, our suppliers, our business partners, and each other.


* Our customers and communities are at the *heart* of everything we do.
* We value and develop our *people*.
* We are driven by *pace*, passion and performance.
* We seek opportunities and embrace *change*.


**Benefits**


* Flexible Schedules
* Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
* Paid Time Off
* 40(k) with Company Match
* Earned Wage Access – Pay on Demand
* Education Assistance
* Employee Referral Bonus
* Meal Discount
* Pet Insurance


**What You’ll Do**


The Assistant General Manager helps the General Manager to ensure that day-to-day business operations run smoothly. This position provides an opportunity for entry-level managers to learn important management skills and practice judgment and discretion skills.


**ROLE PRIORITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Responsible for confidently delivering performance feedback, set goals, foster teamwork, and clearly communicate business objectives.
* Ensure the day-to-day supervision of non-management associates, assigning specified work, focusing on store level operation performance, coaching, and developing shifts supervisors.
* Must be able to competently perform duties in the absence of the general manager.
* Motivate and positively influence staff, especially during times of low morale.
* Strong Leadership and organizational skills
* Addressing issues in a timely fashion
* Ensuring company policies and procedures are followed.
* Maintains an awareness of all applicable brand standards and all procedures and protocols to maximize brand/landlord/labor relations.
* Ensures that the restaurant always looks clean, inviting, and adheres to brand standards.
* Ensures cash management is accurate and processed daily, reports are delivered as per company directives.
* Address customer needs and resolve issues, ensuring positive and long-term customer relationships.
* Ensures inventory data is correct by performing spot inventory counts and checks.


**SKILLS, EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS**


* Passionate about helping people learn and grow the business.
* Strong leadership and management skills with proven ability to motivate and inspire a team.
* Excellent customer service abilities and positive attitude
* Excellent verbal and communication skills with a sharp business acumen
* 2\\* Years experience in quick service restaurant or similar management operations
* Flexible and open work schedule
* Basic food safety understanding and practice.
* Ability and willingness to lift/push objects weighing over 30 Lbs.

*This is not an exhaustive list of all functions that may be required to perform, and the employee may be required to perform additional functions. Additionally, the job responsibilities may change at any time as necessitated by business demands.* Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE), Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran (M/F/D/V), and Drug Free Workplace (DFW).

description:

The **EDI Customer Operator/CSR** is responsible for monitoring incoming and scheduled orders against available inventory & manufacturing.

**Essential Functions:**  

* Conduct accurate and timely processing of **EDI 850 & 860** transactions in Exenta.
* Review non-EDI customer orders and manually enter or import orders into our ERP.
* High level of cross-departmental communications with the Sales Support and Distribution Center teams.
* Review allocation concerns with the sales support team.
* Monitor all orders to ensure timely outbound shipments.
* Give priorities to the warehouse when needed.
* Assisting internal users with requests for order revisions as well as, EDI-related questions & resolving EDI errors.
* Resolving all order-related discrepancies and assisting in vendor chargeback research.
* Daily review of reports that detail order issues with the sales team including the analysis of aged orders.
* Assist various accounts via email and phone regarding the order status, cancellation request, and/or revisions
* Address any requests from the sales and the DC teams related to pick tickets created by the outsourced team.
* Maintain Cross Reference databases.
* Run Critical Item Reports to review potential backorders.
* Review E-commerce orders received from the various direct-to-consumer websites.
* Maintain consistent contact with the sales team regarding discrepancies, missing or incorrect order information, shortages, back-in-stock dates, etc.
* Monitor and update all customer profiles including addresses, shipping terms, and special instructions.
* Perform any other duties as assigned in support of the company's needs and operations.

  

**Qualifications/Requirements**  

* Minimum of 3 years of business experience and experience in Order Management and EDI processing and EDI customers.
* Excellent skills in Microsoft Office including intermediate to advanced Excel and data management (sorting/V-look up and Pivot Tables).
* Excellent communication skills with strong verbal and written communication, analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well in a team environment.
* Strong organizational skills that reflect the ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks and workloads seamlessly with keen attention to detail and follow-up.
* Must be detail-oriented with the ability to work well under pressure. A high degree of detail orientation as well as high degree of accuracy
* Experience working in a fast-paced environment and ability to apply good work habits to effectively complete assigned tasks and contribute to the smooth operation of the company/department.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively under critical time frames and work on multiple assignments and complex and sensitive information.

  

This is an **onsite** working position.  

  

* ***United Legwear & Apparel Company is interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we do not currently sponsor visas. Also, please note that United Legwear & Apparel Company has partnered with USCIS and participates in their E-Verify program.***

description:
**Company Description**


Unity. Loyalty. Advancement. Charity. It’s what drives United Legwear & Apparel Co. to be the best global designer, manufacturer, and distributor of legwear, bodywear, apparel, and accessories. Founded in 1998 by Isaac E. Ash to make the very best legwear on the market, ULAC is an industry leader offering a full range of products for babies, kids, teens, and adults. We strive to sell our products at affordable prices for families. Hard work and exponential growth year on year has transformed ULAC into a global apparel and accessories company.


Our goal to deliver superior products that ensure superior customer satisfaction is made possible by our team of dedicated professionals who work together to make the company the best in business. Our manufacturing, distribution, and logistics division produces the highest quality products at the best possible prices without cutting corners. Integrity of goods is key, so compliance and quality assurance are top priorities, along with meeting every delivery date—whether shipping across the state or around the world.

If you share our vision of delivering superior products in a culture of growth, excellence, and caring, then we want to hear from you!


For more information about United Legwear & Apparel Co., please visit: https://www.unitedlegwear.com

**Job Summary:**  

The Assistant Designer is responsible for providing support to the Designer/Design team in the ongoing development of the line of designated brand right products. Under the supervision of the Designer, this position will be involved in daily projects and responsibilities to help facilitate the execution of the design direction. We are looking for a candidate with a passion for print, pattern, color and textiles.

**Essential Functions (Including but not limited to):**

* Assist Design team in the conception and execution of designated line.
* Create technical packages, art files and update information as necessary throughout development cycle.
* Communicate with cross-functional teams & overseas offices to assist in workload and deliverables.
* Document and preserve all illustrations, design layouts, and design development information for future reference.
* Participate in research and development of the current and the latest fashion trends.
* Adhere to seasonal time and action calendar to meet all deliverables.
* Load range into PLM and create tech packs
* Communicate with factories
* Manage incoming samples, review for accuracy and update to showrooms and archive system.
* Perform any other duties as assigned in support of the company needs and operations.

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Fashion or related area and 2+ years of experience in Design, legwear design experience a plus.
* Solid understanding of customer preferences on fashion and style trends.
* Strong sketching skills, color sense, and fabric knowledge.
* Computer skills to include knowledge of Microsoft Office and Adobe Creative Suite, database systems and internet and ability to learn how to design through new/advanced technology.
* PLM System experience a plus
* Good written and verbal skills and strong attention to detail.
* Strong organizational skills that reflect ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks and workload seamlessly and follow-up.
* Ability to be a team player in a fast-paced environment and apply good work habits to effectively complete assigned tasks and contribute to the smooth operation of the company/department.

**Salary Range:**  

***$40,000-$60,000***

**Workplace Type:**  

*Full-time, onsite*

* ***United Legwear & Apparel Company is interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we do not currently sponsor visas. Also, please note that United Legwear & Apparel Company has partnered with USCIS and participates in their E-Verify program.***
